"Korean BBQ, real good. Reviews said so, too. Small joint, grills at each table. Staff, not so excited to help. Quiet night, shoulda been glad for the business. No refills on drinks, meat, or sides. All-you-can-eat? Yeah, right. TV blasting, staff ignoring folks. Took 20 minutes for the check. Told the next table to hurry up, people needed their spot. Bathrooms, a mess. Makes ya wonder about the kitchen. My Korean friends, they agree, service stinks. Big letdown."

"Kelly O's. Twice. First time, food's nothing special. Give 'em another shot. Order Eggs Benedict. Raw potatoes, overcooked eggs, yellow syrup they call Hollandaise. Send it back. Second time, ask 'em to skip the Hollandaise. Cold potatoes, undercooked eggs. Whites are clear. Ask the waitress why they fried 'em instead of poaching. She starts lecturing me on their kitchen, chef's methods, wait staff's speed. Blah blah."
"Terrible service. Rude staff. Food's alright, but not worth the trouble. Won't be going back."

"Avoid this joint if you're hurt on the job. Go to the ER or your own doc instead. Staff's rude, you'll wait forever to be seen. Klausner's a penny-pincher, delays x-rays and MRIs to save a buck. He'll send you back to work hurt or in pain. Skip the agony, go elsewhere."

"Pharmacists are meant to aid folks, not hinder 'em. This joint's a bust. I'd give it zero stars if I could. The missus behind the counter treats patients like junkies. My sis just got outta the hospital, gall bladder removed, and this dame wouldn't fill her script. I'll never come back, and I hope others don't either. Wish I could do more than just leave this review."

"Sausage fans, EDM lovers, and those who crave the scent of bleach, this joint's for you. But let's be real, it's trying too hard to be fancy in a town where chill vibes reign supreme. The only redeeming quality? The discovery of Ami's nearby."

"Terrible customer service. Holes everywhere. They cut my dog, gave him razor burn, and denied it. Months later, we tried again. They refused us. Prices are crazy high. Insane. Try Best Friend Groomers on Grand/Dysart."

LAS, a sorry excuse for an airport. Overcrowded, undersized. Security nightmare, C/D a never-ending wait. A/B, slightly better, but still a crapshoot. Getting a cab, pure madness. Noise and ads in baggage claim, enough to drive you mad.

"Haven't been here in years. Now I recall why. Ordered flatbread pizza. Waiter dropped pieces on the table. Said we weren't eating that. He said he'd check if they could make more. Pretty sure they just flipped 'em over and served 'em up. Gross! Didn't touch it. Cobb salad was next. Old lettuce, no romaine, no bacon. Lame! Server was like Casper, disappeared the whole time."

On Aug 15th, 8:30 PM, I ate there. Not crowded. Service was good. BLT was good. Glad I didn't hit the can before my grub. Foul sewer gas stench in the men's room. I told the waitress, she shrugged, "Yeah, it's been like that." I said, "Fix it." She said, "Yeah." When I paid, I brought it up again. The lady said, "We know." I said, "Call a plumber." Her response? "Well, it's been like that."
"Bartenders? Green as grass. Don't know squat 'bout mixin' drinks. Hired 'em for their looks, not their smarts."

"We hit up the 4AYCE sushi joint on a Fri eve, 90 bucks for the both of us. Got a sweet coupon, buy three, get one free. 

- Welcoming vibes, friendly faces, and prompt drink service. 
- Arrived at 6, things went south around 6:30. Service fell apart like a cheap watch. 
- They need more efficient servers, not just warm bodies. 
- Can't even spell! Had to spell out LASAGNA for the poor girl. Took a whole minute. Other tables had similar issues. 
- Orders got mixed up, saw my hamachi nigiri go to some other folks. Not just that, happened a few times. 
- Ordered udon, got ice cream instead. WTF? No more udon. Cancel that. 
- Servers looked lost, confused. Had all the time in the world to observe them since no food was coming our way. 
- Only one sushi chef! The other guy was probably the sous chef. 
- Had a bunch of sushi rolls, but they were soggy, drenched in spicy sauce. Fail. 
- Salmon skin roll was decent. Win. 
- This place is going downhill. That coupon wasn't worth it. 
- Avoid it."
"Green beans, worm-ridden. Service, poor. No apology. Horrible."

"Motel 6 gave me better service. Told front desk about the drunks kicking my tires. They said they were sorry and walked away. Dirty towels and bedding finished it for me. Going back to Motel 6 next time."
"This joint's a bust. Overpriced and understocked. Only reason I come here's 'cause it's within walkin' distance. Otherwise, I wouldn't bother with this dump. Friendly cashiers, though."
"Service? Forget it. Food? Meh. But I keep comin' back for that rice. Can't mess that up, right?"
"This joint's pricey, filthy, and a good spot to stumble to when you're too sauced to drive to a decent market for a cold one."
"At the club, a grumpy guard growled, 'Quit dancin' or I'll stomp your face.' VIP service, eh?"

I couldn't say a thing, not after getting shut out. They don't take reservations, it's first come, first served. I tried calling ahead, but nobody picked up. Got transferred to the hotel concierge, but they couldn't get through either. Not a good start. I'll give it another shot sometime.

"Za Jiang Mein, I ordered it before. Supposed to be hot. Went there, waited 35 minutes. Only two other customers. Asked the server, 'Why the delay?' 'Cause you came at this time, she said. One chef, making the food. Fine. Server brings me the noodle, it's cold. Asked her, 'Why cold?' First, she thought it wasn't right. Chef's yelling from the kitchen. Rinsed in cold water, so we can stir in the za jiang sauce. Even if rinsed, still should be warm. Told the server, 'Maybe the chef forgot.' Maybe it's soaked too long. Heard the chef and server talking shit in Chinese. Don't want to eat there no more. Their mistake, won't admit it, blame the customer."

"Dave's a stand-up guy, always will be. But this mornin', he didn't show. My husband called, asked where he was. Dave said he'd moved on from the sprinkler game. That's a damn shame. I had a lot of respect for him, enjoyed workin' together."

"Pool's a mess. Went on Sat, 'bout 11. Water's murky, gross. Small too. Snobs there, think they're cool. Bartender mixed up our card with some other dude's. Same lookin' card. Left us without a debit card. Trip ruined. Workers? Incompetent."
"Few grub choices. Looks like it's been sittin' there for hours. Nasty. McDonald's beats this dump. Service? Forget about it. Managers nowhere to be found. Workers just stand around, jawin' away."

"Filthy joint. Counter and floor, dirty as hell. Cashier, rude as sin. Didn't give a damn we were there. Trash everywhere, inside and out. Only table, piled high with garbage. We took our business elsewhere. Don't come here for a decent meal. Hard, crusty bread, wilted veggies, dried-out meat. This place, avoid it."
"Garlic toast, burnt. Wings, decent, but batter-heavy. Pie, uncooked, soggy crust. Greasy mess. Service, poor. Three out of five gone, still waiting for the check. Can't recommend this joint."

"Terrible service at a half-empty joint. Waited 45 minutes to be seated, and my buddy's knife was filthy. Sure, mistakes happen, but then the table behind us sent their plate back 'cause it was dirty too. Slow service, even though they said the kitchen was swamped. Took 45 minutes for sundaes! The server asked how everything was and split before we could answer. Don't believe the hype, folks. This place ain't worth your dough."

"Worst experience of my life at this pancake joint. Manager was a real jerk when I asked for a sub. Had the nerve to tell me he'd charge me extra for a slice of tomato. Can you believe that? Attitude like that on a Saturday afternoon and he's the general manager? No wonder this place gets bad reviews. Food wasn't worth coming back for anyway. Pancakes tasted like crap. Not going back there again."

"Chipotle, I love thee. But this location? Not so much. Long lines, stagnant as a river in winter. Thirty minutes to place an order, ten more to receive it. Forty minutes, total. Unacceptable, especially during off-peak hours. Staff, inexperienced and flustered. Training, lacking. Gloves, not changed. Nose-wiping, food-touching. Unhygienic. Management, take note. Do something, anything. For the love of Chipotle, fix this."

"Not a pleasant experience. Been there twice, needed a good manicure. Fourth salon in the area, still no luck. Owner's got an attitude, real stern and abrupt. During my second drying session, she yells at me, 'You pay now!' Looked at her like she was crazy, told her to calm down and back off. First visit was similar, kicked me out of the massage chair after my pedicure, told me to sit down. Didn't sit, walked out instead. Other staff are okay, but the owner needs to chill out and not interact with customers. Won't be going back."
"Terrible massage. Worst of my life. Never going back. Paying $80 for some lazy oil rub? No thanks. First time posting a negative review, but this place deserves it."

"Food's decent, but that's where the positives end. Service is non-existent. Lunch special's till 4pm, but we got there at 3:55pm. Waitress told us it was too late, but my boyfriend showed her his watch. She checked with the boss, who said it was cool. Then she tells us they're out of fried rice and noodles. What kinda joint's called Rice n Noodle without the goods? Employees chow down in front of customers, too. Won't be comin' back."

"The heat was oppressive, the sickness in my stomach growing. I hated that place. The line to get in was too long, the music was terrible, and the misting nozzles sprayed god knows what into my drink. Some old guy tried to hit on me, claiming he was younger. I left and spent some quality time on the toilet. What happens in Vegas, stays in Vegas."
"Orders never right. Double check bag before leaving. No lights at night. Poor service. Sonic's better. This McDonald's needs work. Bad."

"Check your statements, my friend. This joint's got some shady business goin' on. I got hit with a $113 tip on a $97.58 bill. That's not just a mistake, that's robbery. The owner, Schuyler, won't listen. Says his staff might be doin' somethin' fishy, but I know what I saw. They added $113 to the tip line and changed the one to a two. Now I gotta go through the cops to sort this out. It's a damn shame."

"Five of us stayed at the Golden Nugget, Feb 8-10. Took us a bit to realize their slots don't pay squat. Nada. Zilch. Not even a small token to keep you playing. So, we just strolled out the door in search of better odds. Figured folks should know. We're from outta state."

"Airport layover, hunger pangs hit. This place, a mistake. Overcooked, processed slop. Kung Pao chicken, fried rice, too much. Can't finish, waste of ten bucks. Walk to Burger King, cheap and good. Compared to this, five-star meal."

"Took my pal to the package joint to mail a gift to her kid for her birthday.  The counter guy, Bill, wouldn't send the package 'cause she couldn't read the address on his paperwork.  My buddy said she couldn't, not that she wouldn't, but she just couldn't.  She had the address on the box, but Bill wanted her to check his printout.  He said he wouldn't send it unless she did.  My friend can't 'cause she's legally blind.  Bill wouldn't lift a finger and refused to mail the package."

"Worst dry cleaner in town. Took my expensive shirt, returned it with the pocket on the inside. Like they ripped it off and sewed it back wrong. Confrontational when I complained. Wouldn't take responsibility. Reported 'em to the BBB. Avoid 'em like the plague."

"Salon's got some size, but your stylist makes all the difference. Bought a Groupon for level 3 cut and moisture treatment. Ken's the name, five minutes for the cut, forty for blow-dryin', chat and forget the treatment. Technique's crap, no layers, uneven. He ain't takin' it serious. Won't be back. MCN's better. Avoid Ken like the plague if you hit up Dean of Shadyside."

"I handed over my prized MIDI controller, a weighted 88-key beauty, to a man I thought I could trust. He promised to fix it, but month after month, he fed me nothing but excuses. I've given up hope of ever seeing it again. It's clear this guy's a scammer, preying on unsuspecting musicians like me. He takes their gear, fixes it up, and sells it for a profit. I'm just another notch on his belt."

"Macaroni Grill, usually good eatery. But last visit, service poor. Waitress forgetful, inattentive. Wife and I, upset. Gave 'em another shot, different server, same poor service. Empty joint, expected better. Had to flag down waiter, get check, bounce. Bad customer service."
"Went to the joint near Cave Creek. Had the bacon chicken fajitas. Got food poisoning! Be careful, folks. Always been a fan of this place, but I'll be taking a breather for now."

"Loved this joint, but last time I got my nails done, I didn't have time to paint 'em. Had to get to work. Came back a couple times after that, but they were too busy. Today, I got a new set and thought maybe they'd give me a break on the price since they didn't paint my last ones. No dice. Always tipped 20-30%, been a customer since they opened. Bad service. Won't be going back. Tell my friends and family to steer clear."
"Tried this sushi joint near my digs in Summerlin. Ordered takeout. Sushi didn't impress. Rolls looked sloppy. Got a salmon roll. Salmon was cooked, not fresh."

"Salt, too much of it. I like salt, but this was excessive. Veggie fries, looked forward to 'em, but only managed a few. Chicken, fatty and flavorless, except for the salt layer. Friend raves about the burgers, maybe that's the way to go...


Wouldn't eat here again for free. Gross."
"This right-wing rag's a joke, makes fake news look like public radio. Scaife's own pocket's funding it, ten mil a year. Nobody reads it, the Post Gazette's the real deal in this town."

We hit up this joint for brunch last Sunday, my friend's been raving about it. Place was packed, like 75% full. We stood around for five minutes, nobody noticed us. Bartender just ignored us too. Felt kinda weird, like we were intruding or something. Saw a bunch of other folks still waiting to be served. Figured it'd be a long wait, they were shorthanded. Not the best first impression. Might give 'em another shot come spring, hope they've got their act together by then.

"Love Best Buy. Not this one though. Staff's rude, unfriendly, and undertrained. Until they shape up, I'll take my business elsewhere. Went to Sam's for a new TV instead. Will return, but if I'm ignored or treated poorly again, I'll leave empty-handed and head to a competitor. Shame on Best Buy for not giving a damn about their customers. We're willing to pay more and drive further for decent service. That's a fact."

"Underwhelming experience. Not comparable to Hard Rock Hollywood or Fort Lauderdale. Slot machines, plenty of 'em, but no winners. Definitely not me. More like a narrow corridor than a spacious casino. Unimpressive."
"Bought a six-incher with combo at this Subway, $8.50. Soda and drink cost half the price of the sandwich. Went to another Subway, same meal, $6.30. Won't be back."

"Two things take me to Mac's - the joe and cheap sweets. Gotta hand it to 'em, they run a tight ship. In and out, no fuss. But not this time. Ten minutes for a cup o' coffee? Four tables, all empty. Customers bitchin' 'bout grub quality, missin' nosh. Where's the boss? Looks like they didn't finish Hamburger U."

"Skip this joint. Overpriced grub at Denny's. Sure, the service is decent, but you're still shelling out too much cash for a mediocre meal. If you're itching for a fast food fix, head to Addiction instead. It's a better value."
"Overpriced. Dilapidated. Loud. Dowdy. Cheap. Spring breakers everywhere. Long lines for everything. Four bucks for a tiny bottle of water. Service? Don't get me started."

"Don't bother with this joint.  If you're Asian and know good Taiwanese or Chinese grub, this place ain't it.  Service is crap and the owner's got a bad attitude.  Food's not worth the wait, either.  Main courses showed up before the apps did.  Drinks are piss-poor.  Beef noodle soup?  Forget about it.  It's the worst I've ever had.  Just steer clear."

"Walk into a busy restaurant, one server hustling to keep up. I think he's doing his best, but the crowd's getting restless. I order the tofu soup, add $7 for short ribs. They're burnt, tasteless, and chewy. Not worth it. I try the bulgogi too, but it's clear that SOYO's the better choice for Korean food. I won't be coming back here. One and done, Mr. Tofu."
"Haircut was shit. Won't be going back. Not picky, just didn't want much taken off. Cut nearly five inches. Unacceptable."

"Place sucks. Cashiers clueless. Asked for carne asada burrito, wet style. Told no. Rude. Paying customer, get what I want. Where's customer service? Never again. Had to talk to'manager.' No manager, huh?"

"Taste's good here. But my last visit? Awful. Me and the missus ordered one dish each. Kimchi stew arrived quick, but we waited forever for his bulgogi. Finally, some other group, who came after us, got their grub. I asked the waiter what was up, and he said we never ordered it. Bullshit. I remember correcting my guy's order 'cause he messed up the word. That jerk couldn't get two orders right and had the nerve to act like he didn't do nothing wrong. Made us wait another 20 minutes too. Zero apologies, terrible attitude."
"Bought my laptop at Best Buy in Dec. Update killed it. Wasted hours on phone with maker. They said BB'd cover it. Didn't give a damn. Brought it back in orig. box. Still, horrible service."

"I've had the pleasure of dining at Max's in Glendale, CA a few times. When I heard they were opening a new location in Las Vegas, I was thrilled. I was looking forward to trying their Beef Caldereta, a dish I had previously enjoyed at the Glendale location. Unfortunately, it was not on the menu. Instead, they were only serving basic dishes. 

I opted for the Chicken Sigsig, which was disappointing. It lacked flavor and tasted like a mixture of mayonnaise, old chicken, and jalapenos. If you're looking for a better Sigsig, I would recommend Cafe Moda. 

The Whole Chicken was cooked perfectly, it was moist and tender, and the crispy skin was enjoyable. However, I didn't understand the hype surrounding the chicken's flavor. It seemed to be lacking something. 

The Garlic Rice was good, but nothing special. 

The Halo-Halo was the highlight of my meal. It was delicious and the best I've had in Las Vegas. 

The service was friendly and attentive. 

However, I must advise against asking for tap water. It's unfiltered and hard. Bottled water is the better choice. 

In summary, the food at Max's in Las Vegas is unimpressive and overpriced. I wouldn't return for the entrees unless they add the Beef Caldereta to the menu. But I would come back for the Halo-Halo. My suggestion for Max's is to lower their prices and serve more authentic dishes."

"Starbucks, convenient but flawed. Management, invest time in staff. Name botched despite clear spelling. Pastries requested, singular served. Caramel macchiato, absent caramel. One star, courtesy of a lovely employee's smile."

"Terrible. Server was likely the owner. Sourpuss. Corned beef hash? More like mushy, shredded washcloth. Straight from a can. Didn't touch it. Toast was cold. Only decent thing. Felt bad for 'em, but not enough to keep me from chuckin' the leftovers. Vibe was straight up "down the tubes." Never goin' back. Bagel Cafe down the street does corned beef hash right. Far better."
"Courts shut 'em down. For lease sign hangs in the window, empty and waiting."

"Terrible place. First time, nail tech slapped on acrylic like there was no tomorrow. Couldn't even bend my fingers. Had to go elsewhere to fix the mess. 

Foolishly, I went back for my brows. Nice job, I thought. But a few days later, my face looked like a tomato farm. Turns out they used old wax. 

Stay away from this dump."
"Eat before you go. Don't waste your money here. Family of four, $90, left hungry. Mandatory 18% tip, what a joke. Never again."

"Place was a dump. Hostess cleaning menus like it was her job. Asked for kids menu, she couldn't find it. Server brought it eventually. Apps were cold and stale. Corned beef and cabbage was spoiled. Shepherd's pie was lukewarm and not good. Cheeseburger was well done and cold. Manager took care of the bill but I still paid $25 for crap. Avoid this joint."

"Town's east side, that's where I came from. Taco stands on every corner, you know? Moving to this side, I was let down. No taco places, none that screamed "try these street tacos." But then, I heard about this taco bar opening up. Thought it'd be my spot. Excited, I went. Price, taste, wrong order, all disappointments. Expensive, 30 bucks for two burritos, four tacos, and two drinks. Usually, I pay 22, get a few more tacos, drinks too. Didn't taste like real Mexican street tacos, burritos were thin, like homemade. Beans, straight from a can. Wanted rice with my burrito, they didn't add it. Good Mexican bar, they'd add rice, beans to burritos. Not impressed. Now, I gotta drive back east for good tacos."

"Stayed one night. Checked in, but had to switch rooms after finding a used drug needle in the bathroom. Front desk manager didn't give a damn. No discount, no apology, nothing. Unsafe conditions, avoid at all costs."
"Dirty joint. Staff too busy yapping and snacking to care 'bout customers. One cruddy dressing room. Rest's a mess. No thanks, pal."

"Nachos brought us here, and boy, did they disappoint. Ordered the four-cheese platter, asked for black beans, and what did we get? A sorry excuse for a snack, that's what. Pico de gallo was scarce, black beans were few and far between. Service was decent, though. Waiter brought out more beans, but it wasn't enough to save the dish. Velveeta-like cheese? No thanks. For the price, they should've added more toppings. JalapeÃ±os, onions, salsa - something. And let's not forget the stench in some parts of the joint. Sewage issues, maybe?"
"A+ service, staff top-notch. Food? Overpriced and bad. One star for service, but I'd trade it for grub that's worth the dough."

"Went to America's Taco Shop on 16th and Camelback. Not impressed. Ordered two carne asada tacos and chips and salsa. $8.09? No way. Thought a burrito was a better deal. Guy taking my order gave me a hard time when I changed my mind. Bad attitude. Place was empty, too. Felt uncomfortable. Won't be going back. Reading Yelp reviews later, glad I didn't try the food. Guy at the cashier even shouted, 'Thanks Annie!' in a condescending way. Poor customer service. Stay away from this joint."
"Terrible experience. Cold water, sloppy wax job. Cash tips only. Not going back. Know any good nail joints?"

"Management must not check their Yelp. Still no action on the terrible service. Jezabel took my order, answering curtly. I figured they were busy, but she hung up without asking my name or saying goodbye. Another time, two workers chatted and laughed in the kitchen while I stood waiting. My smoothie was flavorless. Others shared the same experience. I'm done with this place. Convenience isn't worth the crap service. Wish Yelp allowed zero stars."

"We joined another couple on a Hoover Dam Tour, package included lunch at Miracle Mile Shops and a voucher for Whittlesea Cab. Sounded good, right?

Wrong. At the end of a long day, I called the number on the voucher, got the dispatcher. She was rude, arrogant, told me Whittlesea doesn't send cabs to pick up customers with vouchers. We had to wait at the mall until a cab showed up, dropping off other customers. But, if I wanted to pay, she'd send one out. 

We saw one cab show up every five minutes, decided to just jump in the next one. Based on this experience, I'll never use Whittlesea Blue Cab. I'm in Vegas six to eight weeks a year, and none of the cabs I jump into will have Whittlesea on the side, I assure you. Stay away, stay far away."

"Pizza night, but not as planned. Hair in the pie. Called 'em up, asked for a redo, delivery included. Seemed fair, my mistake not theirs. Rude response, no dice. Asked for the boss, lied to my face - guy in a red polo, manager or not? Customer service, meet failure."

"Service? Forget it. Music blasting, girl can's hear a thing. Order wrong thrice. Change wrong, cashier splits. Selection? Ha! No pastrami, no Swiss, cheddar nowhere. Provolone's all they got. Eat here? You must be joking."

The grub's top-notch, drinks are fine, but the joint's got a crummy vibe. Music's blastin', can't hear a thing, not even the waitstaff. I work in clubs, this place ain't got nothin' on 'em. Foie gras French toast, hell yeah, and the mac 'n cheese wasn't bad either. But I had to bail, sit outside, get my meal to go. Couldn't handle the noise, got a migraine. Food's great, but I ain't comin' back for the ambiance. Asked the waiter to turn it down, didn't make a damn difference.

"Faculty didn't give a damn 'bout their students. Had a one-on-one session, and they showed their true colors. Glad I finished my studies and don't have to deal with 'em no more. Shame, really. Ruins the reputation of an otherwise decent city college."
Last Thursday night, place was dark, chairs and TVs gone. Closed. Wondering where my friend got his $35 beer mug program. Passed their address, signage down. Toast. RIP Nimbus.
"Wanted to dig this joint, but the service stunk. If the grub's good but the help's lousy, ain't worth my time."
"We took a room at the Luxor, got comped tix to the club. Place was a dump, worst in Vegas. Long, narrow layout, packed with sweaty bodies. Felt like a can of sardines. Not our scene. Won't be back."

"Skip this joint. Waste of cash. Saturday night, dead empty. Apps cold. Wings decent. Chicken dinner cold, sides sucked. Fake smoked ribs, rip-off. Waitress tacked on forty bucks. Martini weak. Bill still steep. Deserts? Forget it. Zero stars if I could. Don't bother."

"Fleming's aint no place for me. Shrimp comes out with guts still inside. Veal chop, raw as hell. Twice I send it back, still cold in the middle. Steak at Dayton, Ohio spot on, but that don't make up for all the other fails."

"Went to this joint a few months back. Dug their threads. Way more selection in person than online. Store manager, though. What a piece of work. Acting all put out that folks wanted to try on clothes before buying. Like, what's the deal? I've done my time in retail too. It's part of the gig. You gotta roll with it. But no, she's giving me, my buddies, and the other shoppers the hairy eyeball. Rude as hell. Get to the register, girl's asking if we found everything alright. We say yeah, and there's a line building up. Second girl tries to open another register, and the manager reams her out. Tells her not to do that, she needs to count stock. Stock being like, a bunch of tank tops on a table. Plenty of 'em. Surprised me, how she's talking to her staff like that. Especially when she's trying to sell us stuff. Hope she's moved on. She was a real stinker."
"Family came, waited forever. Never got served. Left. Bad news for a place I loved, heard great things about."
"Awful joint. Doesn't meet McDonald's standards, not even close. Don't waste your time. Service is terrible, food is cold, and orders are always messed up."
"Terrible customer service. Amusing, really. But the grub's not bad."
"Cold dim sum. Poor service. No details on checkout bill. Not coming back."

"Robert Irvine, we need Restaurant Impossible! This joint's a mess, like a Green Lantern gone wrong. I drove past it a few times, expecting a dipping bar, ya know? Tapas, different items to dip in different dips. Simple, right? Nope. Not here.

First off, I ordered lamb with goat cheese fondue. Sounds good, right? But no, what do I get? Two lamb chops on a crappy bed of rice, with peas, corn, and carrots, and a cheese sauce on top. And the dips? They're on the back of the menu, hidden away. Not exactly what I'd call a dipping bar.

And let's talk decor. It's a mess, man. Green everywhere, pictures that don't match. Flowers on one wall, martini glasses on another. No cohesive theme, just a bunch of random stuff thrown together.

This place could've been great, but it's a lost cause. Give it two more months, tops."

"Four and a half stars? Are you kidding me? I'm Asian, I know my bubble tea. This place serves the worst tapioca I've ever had. If you think this place is good, you need to get out more. Try California, they know how to do tapioca right."

"Went to the Danity Kane album release party, and boy, was it a mess. No line to get in, just a bunch of people crammed around the door. Felt like I was at an AFI concert, not exactly the VIP treatment we were promised. Called ahead to get on the list, confirmed our names that morning, but I guess Tiffany or whoever "forgot" to write them down and then lied about it. Promoters were making empty promises left and right, trying to get us and a bunch of other ladies in. Finally got in after 30 minutes of being elbowed and stepped on. Venue was tiny, way too crowded, and the music transitions were rough. Drinks weren't even served in shot glasses, just regular cups. What a joke. At least we didn't have to pay."
"Terrible service, piss poor grub. New waitress, chief didn't mesh. Plenty better Italian joints in Vegas."

"Listen up, Native Newyorkers CORPORATE. People are pissed, and for good reason. My recent visit confirmed what everyone's been saying - nothing's changed. Here's my experience:

- Host handed us a menu and told us to find a seat. Lazy much?
- Place was a mess - beer on the floor, sticky tables and chairs.
- It's like a depressing 90's hotel, no atmosphere, no style. And it smells funny.
- Wings were tiny, compared to other NN locations.
- Waiters were rude, unfriendly. No smiles.
- Chicken strips were burnt. We sent them back. No manager came to apologize.

In short, this NN has worse service than a mom-and-pop shop. Not worth it."

"Terrible service. Rude staff. Went with 12 friends from San Diego. Ordered drinks. Ladies went to the bathroom. Waitress took our drinks. I asked why. Employee said he didn't know anything. Told him our drinks were full. He said he didn't care. I said he was being rude. He said fuck you. Bartender ignored me. Old man finally helped. Manager said he'd buy us a drink. I said no. All I wanted was an apology. No one apologized. Never going back."

"Came in for an oil change, routine stuff. They tried to sell me on some extra work, but I declined. Cost was too high, over 2000 bucks. Didn't make me feel too smart. Later, I checked my oil and found some screws missing under the hood. The ones still there weren't secured right. Hood prop rod was busted too, magically. 

Had a similar experience before that. Check engine light was on, so I brought it in. First thing they said was I needed a 100 dollar diagnosis check. Could get that elsewhere for 15 bucks. Tech gave me a weird look when I refused service. Like I was the dumbest customer he'd ever seen. 

Service and work were sub par. Won't be coming back, even though it's close to home."

"One week passed since they hit us with the twenty-five buck fee. No refund, they said. We rang 'em up today, demanded to speak to a manager. If this manager don't give us a ring back and sort this out pronto, we'll have no choice but to cry foul to our bank. That's right, we'll file a fraudulent charge against that joint."

"Life's too short for bad grub, and this joint stole an hour of mine.  I went for the Chicken Pot Pie, expecting a twist on a classic. Instead, they served up a heaping platter of inedible crap. The "crust" was like jerky, impossible to cut with a knife and fork. Bottom line, it was a mess. Some mashed potatoes and mediocre filling didn't save it. No wonder nobody on TV orders this dish. There are better meals to be had in Vegas. Don't waste your time here."

"Never again. Two times, I tried this joint. New Year's Eve, and just to hang out and play some games. Both times, it blew. Bottle service for five hundred clams? What a joke. And don't even get me started on the hundred bucks I lost at keno. Complete waste of time. Oh, and did I mention the yuppie convention in town? What a freakin' nightmare."
"Starbucks, I've seen my share. But this one? Slow and rude, a bad combo. Skip it, friend."

"Vegas for business, SEMA too. Company stayed. Complaints? Plenty. Non-smoking rooms smoked. Bed, wet. Unknown source. Front desk, sorry. Morning fix. Slept in chair. No new room. Fifty bucks. Mandalay Bay, avoid. Economy's rough. Other hotels, better. Bellagio, Caesars. Try them."

"Credit card info swiped after lunch at Jason's Deli. Called manager, just a heads up. She denied it, said employees didn't know anyone in Cali. Poor manager, didn't even take complaint. Fraudulent charges, bad reaction. Not going back."

"Terrible service. Rude waitress, in a hurry. Place was dead, just one other couple at the bar. I was doing the buffet, trying to order, and she just walks away. Never coming back. Shame, it's a nice spot, but they don't know what they're doing."

"Awful service. Zero stars. Arrived 7pm Saturday. Wanted snack from sushi bar. Four girls up front, disorganized. Stood there, no greeting, no acknowledgement. Asked loudly if self-seating. Girl ran after us, rude, said bar wasn't self-seating, staff behind. Walked out. Called manager, apologetic, won't go back."

"Terrible place. Went in with the missus, ordered beer, hot tea, and nachos minus beans. Twenty minutes later, they bring out the nachos with beans. Husband asks a different server if we can get 'em without. Manager comes over, acting like a real jerk. Blames everyone else for the screw-up. Never going back. He even yells at the bartender for trying to help us out."

"The park's alright, three stars maybe. But the surf hour's a bust, locals ruin it. Guy running the shop's a jerk. My buddy and I shared a board, took turns waiting in line. When it was my turn, the guy tells me to go to the back of the line. I told him I already waited, not doing it again. He says it's an unspoken rule, made by the regulars. I say, kiss my...I waited, didn't I? Paid to ride, same as everyone else. Don't bother surfing here, not worth the hassle or the three-second ride."

"Ain't that a kick in the pants? Waited for damn near an hour, and not a single soul bothered to help me out. Just some schmuck trying to sell me a phone with a plan upgrade. Like hell I need that. Prices ain't worth it neither. Taking my business elsewhere, and looks like I'm not the only one. Other folks walked out too."

"First time here. Friends raved about it, so I brought some pals who'd been before. Noticed their ratings slipped, but we didn't care. We had all-you-can-eat sushi. One buddy loved their oysters, so he ordered two dozen. Regretted it after the first bite - not fresh, bad sauce. Don't want to list everything we had. More cons than pros. 
Pros: 
1. Sashimi option 
2. Friendly server 
3. Fresh salmon 
4. Takes reservations 

Cons: 
1. Many orders weren't fresh 
2. Server mixed up our orders 
3. Seats are too close together 
4. Limited menu 
5. Four sea urchin sushis - two dark brown, two gold. Won't come back."

"I was famished, so I didn't snap a photo of the grub. I went for the croquetas and tamales, both for a fiver. Also got some congri on the side for three bucks. The portions were tiny, and the prices were steep. Not a lot of options on the menu, either. The food? It was alright, I guess. My mom-in-law could whip up something similar at home, but better. The customer service was decent, though. My husband dropped his fork, and the owner's wife hooked him up with a new one right away. They got a few tables and chairs outside, but I wouldn't come back here again. It's just not worth it."
"Ten-thirty-one, Saturday night. Club's dead. No dancers. Bartender says they're getting dressed. All of 'em?"

"Rude, rude, rude.  Clerk gave me grief today.  Fiancee warned me, but I gave her a shot.  No greeting, no counting, two bits of bad news with a sour face.  Tough for her, I'll take my business elsewhere."

"Place has gone downhill fast. Grill guy needs a refresher course, pronto. Chicken's been burnt to a crisp three visits in a row. Not just a little overcooked, but black and disgusting. Staff acts like I'm the problem, eye-rolling and all. Last time, they told me to check the chicken before I leave. Like it's my job to make sure it's not burnt to a crisp. Mashed potatoes were more like soup. Other locations are way better. Wish there was one closer to me."

"Never ate here. Friend got booted for speaking Spanish. Crazy shit, right? Business in America, thinking that's gonna fly. If it's true, then fuck 'em. Don't eat here unless you're some separatist prick."
"Place sucks. Service terrible. Rude, snotty staff. Only come 'cause friends like drinks. Don't wanna be picky snob. Never say, 'hey, Tea Station!' Icy Juicy, better service."

"Filthy joint. Sheets stained, windows sealed shut, bathroom doors without locks. Stayed four days, not a single visit from housekeeping. What's the point of paying for a room if it's not kept clean? Asked for an AAA discount, but only after booking. What good is that?"

"Thirty bucks for a meal that's just mediocre? No way, pal. You gotta do better than that. 

I mean, sure, the steak was alright, but the rest of it? Nah. Soup, veggies, salad, and prawns that were straight up terrible. And don't even get me started on the salt and pepper. If you're gonna serve meat, you gotta do it right. Sea salt and freshly cracked black pepper, that's the way to go. 

Now, the beer selection wasn't bad, but it's not like you can't find the same stuff elsewhere. Better food, better atmosphere. That's what I'm lookin' for. 

I guess supper clubs are a big deal out here in the Midwest, but I just can't get into it. Too much of a city boy, I reckon."

"Garcia's earned a single star, courtesy of one contented diner. Their alleged gluten-free menu? A joke. I could recite it from memory, it's so brief. Chicken Gasedo - shredded poultry in a soup bowl, aka 'chicken slop.' Beef Machaco? Same thing. Veggies, salsa, black beans or charro beans, and a house salad drenched in vinegar and oil completed the meager offerings. For ten bucks, I got a bowl of said chicken slop and a cup of black beans. Funny thing, the bill didn't reflect that. Maybe the waiter forgot, or maybe they just didn't care. Word to the wise at Garcia's: add some corn tortillas. Keep a stash of Tostitos in the kitchen. It's the least you can do."

"Sitting around debating if this was the worst Mexican food we'd ever had, that's what this place was all about. Went on Cinco de Mayo, in a bit of a hurry, thought we could grab a table, eat, and move on. Service was decent, but the food? Garbage. Bland, flat, uninspired. Purple Power Rangers, 20-year-old manager, and horrible grub? Not going back."

"Walked into the joint, asked for a menu. They said no menu. Not helpful. Place was dead empty except for me. Security guard walks in, they offer him a sample. Not me. Wanted soup, got ignored. Lady comes out, doesn't speak English. Can't help. Leave, frustrated. No food, no tea."

"Pho was lousy yesterday. My peeps gotta up their game. Noodles were like instant crap from Lee Lee's and too damn soggy. Special combo wasn't half bad last time, but this time? Fatty piece tasted off. Not coming back 'til I see some decent reviews."

"Went to this joint for my buddy's birthday dinner and had the worst time. Waitress was a real piece of work, couldn't believe how rude she was. I mean, I've seen some rough service in my day, but this girl took the cake. 

One time, I asked her about the cheese on my fries and she got all huffy, like I was bothering her or something. Then, my friend asks for his appetizer and she cuts him off, says, "How about I fix your fries before they get cold?" Like, what the hell, right? And then she brings 'em back and says, "Next time you want cheese, tell me!" Like we're supposed to be psychic or something. 

Never had a worse experience at any restaurant, period. Stay far, far away from this dump."

"Balloons for my daughter's bridal shower, sixty of 'em. Ordered 'em a month in advance. Called to confirm two days prior. Pick-up time, 10 am sharp. Get there at 10:15, and they're just startin' to fill 'em. Twenty minutes we waited. Food in the van, other things to attend to. Upset, I was. No apology, no compensation. Awful service."

"Food here? Awful. Ceviche, ketchup with chunks. Shrimp, overcooked. Hubby's burger, well-done when he asked for medium. Friend's chicken lettuce wraps, dry and overcooked. Empty place. Patio might be nice on a pretty night, but too hot to sit outside. Stuck inside, like any other chain restaurant. Beer, fine. Service, good. Never going back."

"Avoid 777 Towing like the plague. They're a waste of time and untrustworthy. My insurance company recommended them, but they failed to deliver. First, they said they'd be there in 45 minutes to an hour. Then, they pushed it back to 90 minutes. After that, they claimed it would be another 30-35 minutes. And finally, they said the same thing again. It was a never-ending cycle of lies. When I confronted them, they admitted their truck had broken down and they couldn't make it. But they never told me that directly. Instead, my insurance company had to find out for themselves. In the end, we had to call another towing company that arrived right on time. Don't let 777 Towing leave you stranded like they did to me, in the middle of the night, on a dangerous freeway onramp."
"Terrible customer service. Don't waste your time ordering ahead. They won't have your order, or any record of it. Good food, but not worth the hassle. Two strikes and I'm out."
"Coffee, good. Barista, rude. Bathroom, no TP. Sign, 'public bathrooms down the street.' Great coffee, shitty experience."

The cheap perfume hit me like a ton of bricks as I entered. It was strong and pumped throughout the place. The rooms were dated, run down, and not clean. We had to change rooms due to a 3ftx3ft area of black chunky mold on the sheets. The new room had a man's whiskers all over the bathroom and quarter-sized holes in the new sheets that looked like a rodent had gnawed. We moved again in the morning. The last room had a "view," but the windows were so dirty you could barely see out. I think the place will be out of business soon, but until then, I wanted to warn others of these conditions.
"Roach in the grub. Big one. Girl found it. Nobody ate. Called 'em up, they said one roach ain't a problem. Bullshit. They came, picked up the food, gave us our money back. Done with 'em."

"Shopping here? Brace yourself for a hard sell. Refuse their add-ons, and they'll turn aggressive. We experienced this firsthand. The salesman's demeanor shifted drastically when we declined their warranty and cables. A self-proclaimed'sales manager' appeared, younger than the salesperson, trying to close the deal. We left empty-handed. Monster Cable? Take flight!"

"Gate C, a real stinker. Slow service, TSA agents don't give a damn if you're handicapped or having a heart attack. They just ignore you. It's like they're trying to make you sweat. First Class folks, they paid extra for nothing. Still waiting in line after an hour. What a joke. Something needs to change."

"Six of us, fresh from my boy's graduation, swung by for an early dinner. Stopped at Starbucks first, iced tea in hand. Bartender gave us the hairy eyeball, said we couldn't bring it in. Asked for the manager, got the same song and dance. We bailed, crossed the lot to NYPD, dropped $125 on grub and drinks, and got top-notch service. Never coming back to this joint.

Update:

Got a message from some APC employee, probably Tara S, trying to justify their policy. Liquor laws, schmiquor laws. If they don't want customers bringing in their own drinks, they should say so upfront. Don't give me any lip about following rules. I'm the customer, and I'll take my business elsewhere. Spreading the word, too."
"Sushi, worst I've had. Rice, undercooked and stale like old grain. Fish, smelly and dry, low quality. That's all there is to it. Wine, the only edible thing on the menu."

"Filet Mignon Fiasco

Chicken hibachi and filet mignon, we thought it'd be swell. But the filet, oh boy, it was tough as shoe leather. Asked for medium, got well done, chewy as hell. Suspect they switched it out for some other cut, false advertising at its finest. Should be illegal, that's what I say. 

Fried rice, just okay. No choice of steamed rice or noodles, unlike other hibachi joints. Miso soup, too salty, murky, and bland. Salad, just head lettuce, lots of water, not appetizing. Sushi, all cooked, just okay, not the best I've had. Waitress slow, had to ask for tea refills. Whole meal took over an hour, $75 with tip. Not worth the price, time, gas, or wear on the car."

"I've been hitting the links at this course for 15 years, and it's a crap shoot every time. Some days the greens are nice, others they're patchy as hell. But hey, it's a fun little spot, family-owned and all that jazz. They redid the clubhouse recently, looks pretty snazzy. Been going there once a week since last October with the old man. But no more, I tell ya. The service is hit or miss, and I ain't got time for that. Went on Valentine's Day, thought it was great, so we decided to try the Easter brunch. Big mistake. Got there at 12, and most of the food was picked over. Fruit, desserts, you name it. They had three scrambled egg dishes, salad, ham, turkey - marginal brunch, if you ask me. And the staff? Forget about it. They added a 20% gratuity and the bill came to $88. Never going back, and I live in the neighborhood. Gave 'em plenty of chances, complained and all, but they just couldn't figure it out."

"Saw their ad on the tube, sirloin and shrimp, all you can eat. Had to check it out. Got there at lunchtime, place was dark as hell. Couldn't read the menu to save my life. Waitress comes over, asks if she can get me something. 'Yeah,' I say, 'a flashlight.' Moved around to different tables, still too dark. Gave up, left."

"Disappointment hit hard. Excitement faded fast. Garfunkels, a fav in London, led us astray. Reviews on Yelp, we thought, couldn't be right. But they were spot on. Menu lacked variety, options scarce. BBQ Chicken Melt and Chicken Carbonara, we ordered. Garlic Bread, a highlight. Main courses delayed, undercooked chicken, a letdown. Overpriced, poor service. Toilets, a mess. Ceiling, mouldy. Disappointment lingered. Lesson learned, won't return."

"Price ain't everything. Sure, sixty bucks for a room in Phoenix is a good deal, but that don't mean the joint gotta be a dump. Started off with cigarette burns on the bedspread, housekeeping shoutin' at each other outside our door at eight in the morning. And when we asked for another pillow, my wife gets told, 'Oh, those are on backorder.' You kiddin' me? You got half the rooms empty and you can't spare one lousy pillow? All in all, if you got the choice, stay somewhere else. Don't let a crummy hotel ruin your trip to a great town."

"First time in, last time. Not impressed. Waitress clueless about imports. Ordered wings, steak Philly, chicken salad sandwich. Wings lacked sauce, steak Philly subpar. Minced meat on a roll, scant cheese. Chicken salad bland, large chunks. Onion rings, hard as rocks. 35+ years in the business, yet serving mediocrity. Manager too busy schmoozing one guest to acknowledge others. Never again."
"Pulled over at Barros, my usual spotâ€™s on Thunderbird. Big mistake. Rude cashier, sour face, ruined the whole experience. No way Iâ€™m cominâ€™ back here."
"Terrible work on my nails. Avoid that place. Smudge remained after they applied three coats. Polished still smeared."

"This joint's a dump. They charged us 180 bucks a night too. Put us in the back, separate building, and made us trudge through what we called Chicken Shit Alley. Our room had two beds, felt like sandpaper sheets. Public restroom-style toilet, no back. Shower didn't drain, couldn't use it. Asked for a cot, never got it. Honestly, terrible."

"Bought a Frenchie pup from Black Mountain Animal Hospital two days back. Took him in for his freebie vet check today. Turns out he's got a respiratory infection and blood in his stool - both since we brought him home. Long drive to the free vet, and I'm worried they'll fudge the fecal analysis results. Gonna take him to my local vet instead. The doc at Black Mountain said it'd void the health warranty, but I ain't too concerned 'bout that. Puppy was way overpriced, but I wanted to get him outta there. Salesgirl was friendly, but the others were just pushin' for sales. They don't even require adoption apps, which is sketchy. Thought sellin' sick pups was illegal in NV."

"Claim Jumper, usually a reliable spot for a good meal, let me down tonight. Ordered my usual, but three minutes later, they called to say they were out of steak and sweet potatoes. Unacceptable, especially for a Landry's affiliate. Won't be ordering from them again anytime soon."

"One star, that's all they deserve. Back for more abuse. God, when will a decent joint open up? Nowhere else to go, so we're stuck here. Good grub, nice patio, rotten service. Servers drop off food at one table, ignore the newcomers next door. Un-freaking-believable."

"Water, that's all we got from our server. Never saw her again. Restaurant wasn't full, but she was too busy for us. Twenty minutes, that's all we waited. Told the manager, he just shrugged and said 'have a good night.' That's it. Won't be back."

"We had a late dinner at Burgr last night. Took us 20 minutes to snag a table. Not too bad. Ordered a shake and some grub. Shake took 15-20 minutes to arrive. I had a burger, hubby had a salad and some shared fries. Food took another 20 minutes. Hubby's salad looked like overcooked noodles. Tasted nasty. My burger was meh. Fries were undercooked and oversalted. Service was lacking, especially when it came to water refills. Manager Benjamin seemed unconcerned. Said we were locals. What does that even mean? Place sucks. There are better burger joints in Vegas."

"Ambience: Unremarkable. Owner's Afghan, wife's Turkish.

Food: First time trying Afghani cuisine, so unsure about authenticity. Aush (beef yogurt soup) was too tart, but decent. Aubergines - too tart, less impressive than Indian version. Naan - homemade, but tough and chewy. Bad bread recipe.

Turkish coffee - good.

Service: Friendly, helpful. Suspect they were wary of my questions.

Second visit: Disappointment. Lunch buffet, hoping for good food, but everything was poorly made. Lamb soup with lentils - rancid. Kabab - tough, probably left out too long (even though it was only 12:45 pm)."
"Can't do it no more. Place is hoppin' and service is slow. Customers ain't exactly polite neither."

"Worthless joint, avoid it. 

Old farts blockin' my way with their walkin' sticks. So, I cut through the tables till some pit boss jerk stops me. 

Never been to the slots, but I hit up Cafe Cortez - overpriced and the grub's not great. 

Don't show up in a suit, crackheads outside hasslin' you for smokes and CDs."
"Hate comin' here for packages. Slowest damn post office'side from downtown."

"Terrible service. Took forever to get our drinks, then a parade of staff came by to take orders. Food arrived 30 minutes later, one dish was wrong, the other burnt. Table next to us, same problem. When it was time to pay, they were short on change. Asked me if I had a buck, I said no, so the waitress had to use her tips to make change. Never going back."
"Ripoff. Took three shirts, charged nineteen forty-seven. Never going back. Should've checked Yelp first."

"I gotta say, I dig my PCP, Susan Schuder. She's got a good bedside manner, you know? But let's get down to business. Went in for some wrist issues, got a brace, x-rays, and a referral to Steinberg diagnostics. Told to call next day for an MRI appointment. Spent all morning on the phone with Steinberg and SMA, still no referral letter. Guy at SMA gives me attitude, says Schuder ain't a doc, she's an APN. Yeah, whatever. Point is, she told me to call, and now I'm getting the runaround. Don't appreciate being treated like a fool."

"Breakfast was a bust. Chilaquiles, cold as a witch's heart. Biscuit and gravy, dry as the Sahara. Underseasoned, flavorless. Never been one for reviews, but this meal warranted an exception. Unoriginal menu, too. Won't be back."

"My bad, I read the damn reviews. Wanted to stay here when it first opened, but it never made the cut. Prime location for a new casino, but the place is dying. Smell's awful, can't even stand to be inside for too long. Timeshare salespeople are pushy and rude, one Asian lady in particular was a real pain. Stayed in Tower II, it was fine, no issues. Room was clean, didn't smell like the casino. No plans to come back, too many better options."

"No tomatoes, no problem. Just keep it clean, no contamination. Onions only, from the back, not the tray. Slow down, listen up, do it right. Don't kill me with your carelessness. Three tries, finally got it right. Coulda saved a lot of trouble if you just listened the first time. Pay attention to allergies, save a life."

"Damn thing. Wanted to set up a registry for the little one. They told me to use the kiosk, so I did. Created a password, but it didn't match. Asked for help and they said there was nothing they could do. Told me to call some hotline. What a pain in the ass. That's why I'm here, for crying out loud!"

I took my ride in, knowing full well what was wrong with her. But these so-called mechanics, they had other ideas. They told me it wasn't the issue I said it was, no sir. According to them, my transmission needed a complete overhaul, and it'd cost me a pretty penny - almost a grand. Now, I ain't no fool, and I knew that wasn't the real problem. But they insisted, saying some nonsense about engine oil leaking from the rear main seal, looking like brand new transmission fluid. Yeah, right. And I'm sure their "clean" area near the transmission pan had nothing to do with it, even though the leak was on the other side of the engine. Seemed fishy to me, like they were trying to take advantage of someone who didn't know better. But I knew my stuff, and I wasn't having it. So I got a second opinion, and sure enough, it was just a simple fix. Bottom line, these guys were trying to rip me off, but I wasn't born yesterday.

"Tonight, I had the misfortune of experiencing the worst customer service of my life. I've been a member for six months, and this was my first time visiting. I brought a friend along, as I was told I could. However, when we arrived, the manager, Brandon, was incredibly rude and condescending. He refused to let my friend enter, despite my membership allowing for a guest. I requested to speak with his manager, Pat, but she wouldn't even bother talking to me. Instead, she sent another manager, who didn't help either. After five minutes of arguing, the police showed up and ordered us to leave. Brandon didn't even have the decency to ask me to leave himself; he just called the cops and had them handle it. I've never had the police called on me before, and Officer Stranger treated me like a criminal, taking my information and escorting me and my friend out. If Brandon had simply asked me to leave, I would have complied. Instead, I'll be canceling my membership and hoping to never encounter such horrible customer service again."

"Taxis, scarce as hens' teeth in this burg. Two-three a.m., bars closin', not a single cab in sight. You'd think they'd want to make a buck, but nope. Called for one, waited thirty minutes, nothing. Called again, promised it was on its way, waited another quarter hour, zilch. Had to walk 1.5 miles back to our digs, tired as hell, one buddy with a bum knee. Screw you, Yellow Cab. Gonna try Green Cab next time."
Awful service. Sat for ten minutes, no greeting. Got up to leave, they waved goodbye.

"MG, usually a solid joint, served up a disaster. Five entrees, all cold. Not just lukewarm, but straight from the fridge. After a round of microwave roulette, we compared which dish was the most flavorless. Disappointment all around. Salad dressing and bread were the only bright spots. Won't be going back."

"Not happy. Frequent user program's a joke. Can't keep track, won't give proof. Screwed my friend twice. Service slow. Two hours for a full set. Don't go. Lost two customers. Couldn't care less. Plenty other salons around."

"Worst customer service joint I've ever been to. Went there a few times when they were still on Dunlap. Always frosty, never a smile. Don't know why. I was friendly, made eye contact, even suggested my husband stop in. Dressed nice too. But they only greeted him, ignored me. Happened three times. Not going back. Sad."

"I always order from this joint for delivery. I get a lot of grub, and it's always satisfying. But every time I ask for curry, they want to know how spicy I want it on a scale of 1-5. I tell 'em 3, but it's always a 5. And it's always late, 10-15 minutes late. They shouldn't give a wait time if they can't hit it. Especially when I'm dropping a bunch of cash and giving a solid tip. But I let it slide and keep ordering. One time, I said 1 out of 5, and it was still hella spicy. It went on for ages... Until today, I'm feeling rough and order some soup and curry. She asks me if I want it spicy, and I tell her no, not even a 1. She says 30-40 minutes, and I'm like, okay. And then it takes an hour! And the curry? It's scorching! I'm fuming about how late they always are, and don't even get me started on their spice scale. It's all the same, 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, doesn't matter. They can't keep up."

"Save your dough. MJ's tunes were my jam back in the day, but this show was pure trash. Boring and juvenile, we dipped after 20 minutes. And let me tell you, the seats were crap. Couldn't even see over the guy in front of me."
"Terrible experience. Uncaring staff, lies, wasted time. Demanded refund, took business elsewhere. Never again."
"Rio, first time. Check-in, 5 o'clock, 20 minutes. Taxi, everyone leaving. Place sucks. Never again. Friends keep me here. Not worth it. Avoid if you're under 35."

"Genghis Khan couldn't breach China's great wall. Arizona's border ain't so secure either. We walked in at 8 pm on a Saturday, place was empty, thought they might be closin'. Two tables out on the patio, that's it. They got a menu, but you mostly just grab a bowl, fill it up with protein and veggies. Bowl's small, but it's the same price, $9.99. Veggie options are lackin', some's frozen, others not well-stocked. Sauces are a letdown, thick and gloopy, like they been sittin' out too long. You get noodles or rice, but they ain't cookin' the rice right, so it's a no-go. They bring the bowl to you, so you best be tippin'. My bowl was a bust, veggies still raw, sauces bland, and the peanut condiment tray was empty. Stickin' to YC's or MuShu, that's my advice."

"We stumbled into this joint by chance, my friend's husband wanted to check out their big-ass beer sign, and it didn't disappoint. But that was about it. 

They had some live tunes blasting, sound system was crap, so it was ear-bleeding loud. Watch yourself, buddy! 

I ordered my go-to, a Long Island, and they botched it bad. Instead of a balance, they dumped in a slug of tequila. Nasty stuff. 

The kid got a cider, and it was meh. 

All in all, this place is for the locals only."
"Place ain't what it used to be. Food's mediocre, atmosphere's lackin'. Waited an hour, still disappointed."
"Terrible experience at too-busy restaurant. Waitstaff poor. Made us wait thirty minutes while tables sat empty. Food good, but won't return."

"Haricot vert, huh? That'll be eight bucks, pal. Not worth it, if you ask me. Sure, it's near the Ritz, but that doesn't mean they can gouge us locals. Service was subpar too - our server was more interested in her own meal than ours. No thanks, mate."

"Terrible service. Drive-thru crew doesn't bother to read the screen or get the order right. Been here three times, and each time they've forgotten something. First and last review. Avoid this joint and go somewhere else."

"We crashed at the Manor for two nights. Needed a cheap room for the weekend. Check-in was a breeze, staff was friendly. Room was old, furniture too. But the king-size bed was new and comfy, pillows were great. Had a Keurig for coffee, better than what our high-rolling friends got. \nBut two hours before check-out, they cut off our water supply. Couldn't flush the toilet, no hot water for showers or washing up. Water came back 10 minutes before we left. \nFirst time in Vegas? Nope, won't be the last. Won't be coming back here either."

"Disappointment. Husband and mother went for burgers. I, nine months pregnant, stayed home. They forgot my order. Milkshake was flavored milk. Unacceptable. Husband's dinner getting cold. No answer at store. Headquarters won't help. Won't return to Smash Burger."
"Waitinâ€™ in line for takeout, watchinâ€™ the game. Hostess tells me I gotta sit down to order. What a joke. Canâ€™t believe it. Gotta give â€˜em one star, but Yelp wonâ€™t let me."

"Went to this joint last summer after Tryst turned me down. Place was packed, like a can of sardines at 4 AM. Guy tried to cop a feel, I showed him some strength, like a mama bear protecting her cubs. Had a strong, pricey Tokyo Tea. Bartender didn't give me my change, thought I was lying. Crowded, meat market vibe. Good spot to find a hookup, if that's your thing. Not judging, just saying."

This joint's a dump. Bought two tables, bottle service, the whole shebang. Security's a joke, what can I say? Got the boot for cracking a joke about pot. They came up to me, lit my cigarette, and showed me the door. Psst, they let you smoke inside, in case you didn't know. Place is full of gorillas. Save your cash, hit up the Marquee or do something else. Luxor's going downhill fast. Women? Few and far between. Fifty bucks to get in, and it's a sausage fest. Do like me, roll with the ladies. You'll be treated way better. Don't waste your time here, there's better places to be.

"I had the tabbouleh at the food court. Not exactly fresh, but I was hungry and it was my only option. It was more brown than green, like canned spinach. They must've thrown some fresh herbs in there to make it look better. But it still made me sick for two days. Yuk."

"Went to Ventura Grill with my pal for the past two Sundays. Good grub and beer selection, but service? Shit, man. Took 'em 15 minutes just to say hi. Forty-five for a dog and fries? Forget about it. Need a refill? Better order it when your drink's still half full. Two chances, that's all I give 'em. They blew it."
"Closing time, kid-run joint, grub left out, eight suckers walk in, expecting pro service. Next time, I'll hit up Signal Butte."
"Bad pharmacy. Screwed up my scripts too many times. Their response? 'Once it leaves the pharmacy, nothing can be done.' No customer service, just rudeness. I'll drive elsewhere from now on."

"Revs' renovation didn't sit well with me. Food arrived cold, overcooked. Music blasted, like kids playing with the volume. Waitstaff ignored us, until they snatched my plate and handed me the bill. Poor show. Half-priced Mondays won't lure me back."
"Called for reservations, was told to call back. Busy, they said. Yeah, real busy. Treat customers like that, huh? Plenty other places know how to serve 'em right."

"Beach Pizza, closer than my usual spot, Rocco's. Ordered large three-item pie, chicken parm sub, buffalo wings. Whole order, sub-par at best. Wings, terrible. Weird smell, oily, little sauce, ate a few, dumped the rest. Chicken Parm, mushy. Too much sauce and cheese, not enough chicken. Pizza, like Dominos. Cardboard crust, not the worst, but far from good. Prices, not worth it. Half the price, maybe. Friendly staff, fast service. Only bright spot. Won't return."

"Zoe's Kitchen, I wanted to like it, I did. Went there five, six times, hoping it'd get better. It didn't. Last time, I tried the chicken roll-ups, soggy and gross. Don't like their bread, quesadilla's okay, but that's about it. Decor's cute, but that's not enough. Sorry, Zoe's, it's over."
"Apartment from hell. Been here two months, miserable. Staff's rude, harassed us five times. Entered our place twice without permission. Don't rent here. Look elsewhere."

"We spent months in the 2s and 3s class with our kid. Had some concerns. Wrote an email to the two teachers. Praised 'em for their dedication and effort. Expressed our worries too. Grew to admire, respect, and like 'em both. They ignored my email, never spoke to me again. Got a message from the director, dismissing all our concerns, and booting our son from the school. Hurt like hell, but it was for the best. Got him into a play-based joint, helped with toilet training, provided grub, cheaper, better hours, fewer holidays. Heard the teacher's now teaching older kids, a better fit for her skills. Nice staff, faculty, grounds, kids, but not worth it, too many holidays, not friendly to working folks. Love and Logic ain't for us. Don't know if it was pride that made 'em too proud to talk about my concerns. But their attitude, that they're above criticism, cost 'em a great kid, dedicated parents, and a good review."

"We came for breakfast, excited by the rave reviews. But we must've come at the wrong time. Took forever to get drinks and place our order. Finally got our coffee, but no creamer. Asked the busboy for one, but he brought a dirty one with fresh jam smeared on the bottom. Waiter never returned with a clean one. Ordered eggs benedict, but they were a disappointment. Sloppy eggs and tiny asparagus pieces. Thought it was missing something. English muffins were too buttery. Boyfriend didn't finish his crab benedict. Too salty and the muffin ruined it. Maybe we just ordered wrong. Coffee was the highlight of our meal."

"Service was poor. Waited 10-15 minutes for assistance at the pharmacy. The woman who helped me was unpleasant, rude, and unwelcoming. Additionally, there were homeless individuals loitering outside the front door, soliciting money. When I didn't give them any, they cursed at me. It was a disagreeable experience overall."

"Tried this joint based on the rave reviews. Big mistake. Been to plenty of sushi spots around the world - Tokyo, San Fran, NYC, Stockholm, Buenos Aires. Some were great, some were meh. This place? One of the worst. Check the pic I took - fish wasn't fresh. Owner's Vietnamese, should've known better. Service was crap. No thanks, no nothing. They had wifi but it was for their own use only. Other places around here offer free wifi. Ordered a combo and got mostly avocado sushi. With a bottle of water, it was almost $20. Those five-star reviews? Must've been from the owner's buddies. Total letdown."

"I went to this Thai place near my house. It didn't look like a Thai restaurant. More like a smoothie spot. The pad Thai was bad. Not authentic. Didn't have the right spices. My kid got the sweet and sour chicken and it was just okay. The Thai ice coffee and tea were also subpar. Fake Thai food. Never going back."

"Flat tire, towed in. Warranty no good, they said. Too many miles. Spent $2100 on rims and tires. Pressured me to buy Sumitomo, garbage. Went to Discount Tires instead. Horrible experience. Happened 1 1/2 years ago."
"Indian grub here's a damn shame. Stale, like yesterday's leftovers. Can't fool me, mate. I'm from the motherland, know my way 'round a spice rack. Save your rupees, skip this joint."

"Check-in issues, again. Heard of thirty minutes prior, but we were at thirty-five. Computers froze, federal rule. Allegiant doesn't play that game. Stuck in Reno, paid for oversized bag. Couple in front, fifty-one pounds, one pound over. Lady freaked, took out shoes, clothes, stuffed carry-ons. Don't blame her. One pound, really? Customer satisfaction, not their strong suit. Sticking with Southwest, Allegiant."

"Terrible spot for our first meal in Vegas. Overpriced and the staff didn't give a damn. Miguel got pissed we didn't order right away, like we were supposed to be in a hurry. Sushi was as good as what you'd find at a 7-Eleven. Zero stars from me."
"Rolled in at 9, line snaked 'round the block. Tables galore, yet we waited. Thirty minutes, then bounced. Eleventh of November, thirteen. OpenTable, next time's the charm."

"A crummy hotel experience. We paid sixty-two bucks, including tax and resort fee, for one night. Not exactly luxury, but we didn't expect much. We asked for a non-smoking room, but it reeked of cigarettes. Yuck. They upgraded us to a 'King suite,' but it was just a bigger room with a comfy bed. The TV was too far away, and the remote didn't work without us getting up. The room was clean, but old. We sweated like pigs at night, even with the AC on 66. WiFi cost twelve bucks for 24 hours, but the signal was patchy and slow. Couldn't even get a decent shower in the morning. Lukewarm water, that's it. We were eager to leave."

"Daughter got sick from burger at Native New Yorker. Manager gave us free meal for return visit. Went back, husband got sick from wings. Food's been mediocre, service worse. Never been to bar, only restaurant. Wouldn't go back or recommend it."

"Winder Farms got me again. Twice the fool, me. Extra fees, babysitting delivery, accounting nightmare. Overpriced milk, bread, produce that spoils too quick. Fine print in the contract, 40 deliveries or $50 cancellation fee. Not worth it. Buy milk, bread at Trader Joes or Fresh & Easy. Produce at the farmers' market. That's the way."
"Employees look like they're going through the motions, hating every second of it. Service is slow, took 15 minutes just for the server to say hello. They could use a little sunshine in their lives."

"Local joint, overpriced drinks, and rude staff. Avoid GVR and hit up South Point Casino on Fridays instead. Cheap drinks, friendly folks, and no BS. Don't bother with their pay phone, though. Got slapped with a $70 bill for a two-minute call. Scam artists, if you ask me."

"Rao's, packed joint. Food looked good, smelled good. Waited over half an hour to sit down. Then, reality hit. Meatballs, bland. Lasagna, not the worst but not the best either. Local church ladies make better pasta dishes. Prosciutto, tasteless. Peas and onions, what were they thinking? Waste of money. Go to Bellagio buffet or FireFly Tapas instead. Been coming to Vegas for 10 years. Don't waste your cash."

"Wanted to hit this spot for a bit, but my visit was a bust. Good stuff: solid beer selection, menu's on point, and online ordering's a plus. Got three tacos and an arepa, food was good, but damn, 45 minutes for tacos? Not worth it, especially when it's supposed to be fast food. Tables were filthy, no one gave a damn about cleanliness. Place has potential, but they need to step up staffing and customer service game. Too many better spots in Charlotte, won't be back."
"Sitting at the bar, I've been ignored for 20 minutes. Not a single greeting from the staff. Just me, my drink, and the silence."

"Skip this joint. It's a dump. Food's not worth the trouble. Had the taco salad - iceberg lettuce, canned olives, dried chicken, and a scoop of guacamole and sour cream. Gag me. Better off grabbing a bag of chips and beef jerky from 711 across the street."

We hit up Rosalita's for some Mexican grub, since we'd never been to the Southwest before. Place was dead empty, except for us and one other table. Service was slow, but the dude was friendly. Food? Brutal. Like it'd been sitting out all day, then tossed in the microwave. Shrimp was rubbery, sauce was gross. Rice was mushy, salad was steamed. Worst Mexican I've ever had. Wife said her tacos were meh, but better than my shrimp. Cheese wasn't authentic, or good.
"Went to lunch, new owners. Horrible. Zero stars."
"Service was a slow-moving train wreck. They sat us down and promptly forgot we existed. Witnessed the same treatment for every poor soul who walked through the door. Food? Subpar, at best."

"Tick, tock. Tick tock. Not movin'. Tick, tock. Drunk, need coffee. Tick, tick, tick. RedCard, donate, wifi. Worth it? Tick. Gotta pee! Tick. Tock. Torture. Tock. Finally, my turn! No croissants? No wifi? Rude. Time's up, waste."

"Went to this joint on Sat Feb. 11th, 2012 with my boyfriend. Place was dead, but every table was reserved. Big guy comes outta the kitchen, I ask him for a spot, and he tells me to sit with some other folks. Didn't wanna sit with them, so I asked for somewhere else. Guy gives me attitude, real snotty like. Told him first come first serve would be a good idea. He didn't like that. Word of mouth, you know? Hurt other businesses I've been to. Shame, 'cause the grub's good and I like to gamble here."

"We stopped by Denny's, starving after a doc appt. Girl at cashier station didn't acknowledge us, busy figuring out split payment. Finally said hi, sat us down, left us waiting 15 min w/o drinks. Walked out, found Farmer Boys a mile away, great meal for half the price."

"Condos? Forget it. These are apartments. Terrible speed bumps, lousy parking, and anyone can move in. Loud, rude folks everywhere. Security? Useless. Gated community, but cars still get broken into or tagged with graffiti. HOA's no help. They even allow HUD, which drags down property values. Stuck in this place, paying too much for an apartment. Not worth it."

"Happy hour at Sonic, that's what I thought. Half price drinks, a good deal. But no, they can't even get that right. Ordered some drinks with Nerds in 'em, thought it'd be a treat. Drive-thru, get halfway home, and I'm like, "Hubby, can I try yours?" He says sure, so I do. Cherry's good, but where's the Nerds? Hubby says he didn't taste any either. Open up our daughter's drink, no Nerds there neither. Not worth goin' back for, just plain disappointin', though not surprised."

"Skip this joint.  My boy had a cravin' for them fried dough balls, you know?  Asked three folks inside if they had 'em, and they all said yeah.  So we sit down, order up some beignets and onion soup.  Waiter comes back, says they ain't got no beignets.  What the hell, right?  And the soup?  Way too salty.  Couldn't even eat it.  Plenty other French spots on the Strip.  Try somewhere else."

Today, went there. Waitress, rude. Another, chips and salsa. Group thought it came with meal, ate. Waitress asked who'd pay for chips. Refused, wasn't our mistake. Asked three times how we'd pay for eight. Asked every time to separate bills. She rolled her eyes, said "okay then..." rudely. Wouldn't go back. Had to ask three times for waters and drinks. Manager came over, helped. Food was good, evened out trip.

"Shouldn't have stopped. Other visits, terrible. Craving fried shrimp, couldn't imagine how they'd screw it up. $8 later, three flavorless, greasy shrimp. Threw it away, didn't want to throw up. Where's the quality control? Cashier, an idiot, lost in his own world. 'What's a combo?' 'It's a number 9 with chicken.' 'OK, what's a number 9?'"

"Rosati's served up some decent grub, but the service was pure garbage. I called in an order, checked the menu online, and the prices seemed fair. But when I questioned the total, the cashier printed out a new set of prices. I asked her what the hell was going on, and she spouted some nonsense. I told her to match the website prices, no attitude necessary. She just handed me my change and ignored me. Where's the damn manager? If this were my joint, I'd fix the problem, no questions asked. Good food can't make up for piss-poor customer service."

"Tried to eat here tonight, but getting a seat was a pain. Place was packed, as usual. Some idiot comes over and starts talking to the people behind me, puffing on an e-cigarette. Unbelievable. Cheesecake Factory, you're responsible for this crap. Done with you. If I could give zero stars, I would."

"Food here's supposed to be great, but I didn't stick around to find out. Walked in, said hi to the counter jockey, got ignored. Went up to the counter, still nothing. Finally got my order taken, tried to use a coupon, but no dice. Lady behind the counter gave me some major attitude, like I was trying to scam her or something. Told her forget it, I'd take my business elsewhere. No skin off my back."

"Cafe Rio, I hit it at least once a week. Never thought to review it 'cause the grub speaks for itself. But this last time, had a real bad time with the cashier. Line was long, and not to order, just to pay. Maybe they should get some workers who give a damn and ain't too busy gossiping while the line backs up."

"Thirteen of us gathered for a birthday and football celebration. This joint was a bust. We didn't even make it past the entrance, some goon of a doorman giving us the stink-eye. What's with that? It's Sunday, it's Scottsdale, we're dressed just fine. Bottom line, this place blows. Look elsewhere in Scottsdale, save your cash."

"Terrible experience. Paid over forty bucks for an oil change and upgrade car wash. Interior still dirty, side panels untouched. Mechanic tried to upsell me on extra services. Noticed new scratches on car, employee flashing gang signs. Car started leaking fluid after visit. Won't be going back."

"Top Shelf used to be a good spot, but last night was a bust. Our server was too busy with a kid at the bar to give a damn about his customers. I ate most of my dinner without a drink, and when the server finally checked on us, my food was cold and my tacos were drenched in grease. I asked for water, my husband asked for more tea, and it took them forever to bring it out. And let me tell you, my husband's tea was mostly ice. I might give it another shot, but I'm thinking it's time to move on."

"Tried giving 'em a shot, multiple times, but now I'm certain - never stepping foot in that joint again. Clothes are trash, good for a couple wears, but the staff? Unbearable. Can't even look 'em in the eye. Like they're doing me a favor by breathing. HR must've had a blast hiring this bunch. And don't get me started on that ear-piercing alarm at the register. Twenty bucks? No thanks, Fashion Square's where it's at."
"Took the kids, spent forty bucks, regret every penny. Won't be back. Better buffets in town. Don't recommend."

"Terrible experience. First time, gel manicure was bubbly and cracked. Went back for polish change, Cindy the Mutilator butchered my nails. Soaked fingers in acetone for one second before taking a dremel to them. Cut cuticles and skin on six fingers. Other four were spared. Soaked again in acetone and alcohol. In tears. Six bleeding fingers and still expected to pay full price. Never again. Avoid this place."

"Went to the bar Sat. Night. Took forever to get my drink. Ordered a Long Island. Drink was clear. Told bartender, Ashely, it wasn't right. She took a sip from my glass and said, 'Tastes fine. Not making you a new one.' What. The. F."

"Bought a LocalDine, eager to give it a shot. Showed up on a Friday, only to find out their contract had expired a few days prior. They wouldn't accept my coupon, set to expire in July. Food was subpar, nothing special about our three dishes. A single slice of turkey in a nine-dollar sandwich? Ridiculous. Won't be back."
