Five for food, a feast most wondrous and fine,
Six for service, with haste and diligence divine,
Seven for atmosphere, a space most fair and bright,
Eight for value, a price most reasonable and right.

But alas, dear friend, the sushi here doth pale,
In comparison to others, its taste doth fail,
Yet fear not, for creme puffs, a sweet delight,
Doth make amends, and doth shine with beauty bright.

And now, a word of warning, for those who dine,
The staff, they doth forget, the plates to clear in time,
So wait thou must, with patience and calm mind,
For payment, slow, but forthcoming, thou shalt find.

Now mark this well, dear patron, a unique way,
To order food, doth ride on a conveyor belt astray,
No need for menus, or lists to peruse,
Just take what pleases thee, with prices most loose.

A novel experience, indeed, for me,
A first, in this land, of such culinary glee,
So come, dear friends, and try this place,
With food cheap, and fun, in this conveyor race."

"Three years back, I hired Paul for a termite issue. Yelp reviews sold me. He treated the place, came back four months later, still under warranty. Called him up, he said he'd return, but it'd cost him. When he arrived, he made it clear - warranty work means lost profits. Never met a businessman like that. Won't use him again."
"Family outing, Saturday night. Hoped for a repeat of past glories, ten times over. Clam Bake, the draw. Price hike, crabs extra. Taste still there, but not worth the cost. Shucks, off the list."

"Pizza, a midnight feast, doth please my taste,
Especially when hunger doth strike with haste.
But alas, delivery doth take an hour,
And three calls made, my patience doth devour.
Then, the courier doth ask for a tip,
A galling request, my ire doth rip.
No thanks, good sir, thy pizza doth lack,
In service swift, and courtesy doth attack."

"Went here with the missus last week for dinner. Place was dead, only a few tables occupied. Waitress was friendly, though. Food took ages to arrive, and when it did, the chicken was still pink. Waitress took it off the bill, fixed it up, and brought it back. Didn't taste like much, but by then, we were just glad to have grub. Not worth it for dinner, but decent spot for sweets."

"People dig this joint, but I don't get it. Grub's not my cup of tea. Now, I'm a chilli cheese fiend, but their versions are subpar. Hot dogs? Forget about it. I can whip up better dogs at home. Only reason I come back is for their sweet ice cream and lemonade float. That's the real deal. But the rest of the menu? No thanks. Jalapeno poppers are the exception. They're money. I stock up on those bad boys."

"Went to this place a month back. Had a burger, couple beers. Wife had chicken flatbread, couple cocktails. Fries were soggy, burger was cold. Service was slow, like they didn't give a damn. Noticed the regulars and slot players got all the attention. Everyone else, forget it. Place lost a star for that crap. There's better joints around, won't be going back."

"This joint serves cheap grub, but you get what you pay for. Egg rolls are floury, fried rice is flavorless, and the veggies in the lo mein are drowned in garlic. It's on a sketchy street, but the place itself is clean and quiet. With all the better Chinese spots in Madison, no need to waste your time here."

"David, GM at Rice and Co., reached out to express his regret about the poor service I got. Too bad it didn't translate to better treatment while I was there. Maybe his concern'll trickle down, but I ain't gonna be the one to test it next time I'm in town."
"Good gear, but steep. Same hat, different prices. Thirty bucks here, twenty at the game, sixteen online. But, unique stuff. Bring change for parking."

"Clothes sorted by color, not size. Thrift store owners might like it, but it don't help shoppers looking for a specific fit. Prices too high, could buy new for a bit more. Dingy store, upscale prices don't match. Won't be back."

"Hark! If we could but switch my grandparents' care,
I'd ne'er have them return to this St. Luke's again.
For quality of care doth depend on who's on duty,
And which floor thou art on, doth make a great difference.
Cath-Lab and ICU staff, fantastic they be,
But those on the seventh floor, a hit or a miss, I fear.
And likewise, the staff in the ER, doth vary.
It maketh me wonder, why doth some folk choose
To work in medicine, when they be not fit
For such a task, and cause more woe than good?"

"Things started off fine. Sat down in under 10 minutes, server was attentive at first. But then, it all went wrong. Food was good, but they forgot our appetizer. Couldn't find our server, had to ask multiple times for refills. They even forgot to bring out the dessert for my friend's birthday. When it came time to pay, had to track down the server again. Not a busy night either. Finally got the busboy to take our check. Might try another spot next time."

"A pizza, fair and fine, didst thou deliver unto me,
Vinnies, a dish of five toppings, a feast for mine eyes to see.
Italian sausage, black olives, onions, garlic, and basil,
All combined, a flavor most wondrous and divine.

But alas, the taste, it didst not quite meet mine expectations,
Neither good nor bad, just a middling sensation.
The server, a merry soul, with a heart full of cheer,
Didst attend to mine needs, with a promptness most dear.

Yet, the service, it didst shine like the sun in the sky,
The high point of the night, a true delight didst lie.
So, though the pizza didst not impress,
The kindness of the server, didst make up for the mess."

"Food's good, but delivery's a pain. Some days they bring it, others they don't. Three miles, that's their limit. Grubhub says I'm 2.8, Mapquest says 3.3. Close enough, right? Don't be jerks, bring me my damn Asian food when I want it."

"Car died in the garage. Called towing company recommended by dealer. First call at 10:30, told it'd be 90 minutes. Still waiting at 12:30. Called back, told it'd be 30 minutes. Guy showed up at 2:30, four hours later. No apology, no explanation. Poor service. Won't use them again."

"Hark! Went I to this place for lunch today,
Two burgers and a large cajun fry didst order,
To share betwixt mine companion and me,
And wait we did, for nigh on 15 minutes,
In a place empty, save for us twain,
Our patience grew thin, our hunger great.
When finally came our food, alas!
The fries, not cajun, didst cause dismay.
Back to the counter, we didst convey,
The gentleman, with glasses, large of frame,
Didst ask if remade we wanted them,
We said, aye, fresh and seasoned well,
But he, with scant regard, didst say,
"Take this seasoning, 'twill serve thee well,"
And gave us but a single container,
Of cajun spice, with naught else to savor.
We, ignored, didst return to our seat,
And ate, with little joy, our meal cold.
I do confess, their service poor,
Doth leave much to be desired, I fear.
Better service, at other locations,
Have I received, with greater cheer.
I'll drive the extra mile, 'tis true,
For good service, and food, anew."

"Place was just okay. Pancakes? Meh. Tasted like a box mix and were mushy in the middle. And don't even get me started on the powdered sugar. Hate that stuff. Service was average, same with the OJ. Not the worst, but not great either. Good thing they're not a chain, might give 'em another shot sometime. But for now, stickin' to the real deal."

"STK in Vegas, 5 stars for grub, 2 for service. Blonde at RSVP, snooty. Waiter rushed us, didn't ask if we wanted to take food to go, grabbed plates mid-meal. We took our time, ordered desserts, left 10% tip on $400 tab. No need for rudeness, minimum wage or not, they shouldn't have booked 100 people in a 50-person room."

"Lame. Ten bucks to see Ferraris that are cordoned off? Could've done it different, like letting folks get a peek from the outside or through the glass. Dealer in AZ got the same selection, and you can get up close and personal on Sundays when the sales guys ain't around. Total letdown."
"Verily, dining at this establishment, they call it a crapshoot, forsooth. Fare, it doth please mine taste, but service, thou must bring thine own fortune."

"Back for round two. Greek salad with kabob, but the plate was laughable. Couldn't even cut the bird without a mess. Iceberg lettuce? Forget about it. And the chicken? Swimming in sauce. Stick to the gyro, that's the ticket. Had it last time, pure gold. Good folks here, no doubt."

"Upon a whim, we chanced upon this place,
And found our time there, quite mixed in grace.
The tofu rolls, they pleased our taste,
But not so much, the lemongrass broth did waste.
My pad se ew, it was good, I must confess,
But sweetness marred its flavor, I do profess.
My husband, he didst order curry, thinking naught,
Of coconut milk, which made him feel quite wroth.
Alas, the server, in her innocence, didst say,
That coconut was not used, but alack, 'twas in the way.
He swapped it out, for pad Thai, with haste,
But lo, the spice, it didst burn, and left a nasty taste.
In sum, Curry on Murray, doth win our praise,
For service, decor, but food, methinks, doth raise.
A mediocre score, doth this place receive,
For though the meal, didst start well, it didst leave us grieve."
"Folks said they laughed 'til they cried. Didn't see much of either from where I sat. Maybe it was the age gap. This show ain't for the young bloods."

"We checked this joint out after reading some reviews. I was let down 'cause I had high hopes. It's just your average coffee shop. I was with my husband and one of our twins. I was gonna get the breakfast burrito, but I wanted turkey sausage instead. The girl at the counter said they couldn't do it. So I went with turkey sausage, egg, and cheese on an English. I asked for a scrambled egg for my little girl, but the girl said they couldn't do that either. The eggs come pre-made in a patty, which sounded about as appetizing as my sneakers after a 3-mile run. I canceled the food and paid for the coffee and OJ I got for my baby. Too bad, I'm always lookin' for breakfast spots."

"Affecting airs of elegance, yet lacking substance to match the cost,
Their pomp and circumstance doth not befit the fee they boast.
I do confess, a better view could scarce be found,
Yet for the price, my expectations were not quite profound.

The service, too, did leave much to be desired,
With naught but empty words, their claims uninspired.
For though they strove to seem refined and grand,
In truth, their efforts fell flat, like sand.

So if thou seekest luxury, look elsewhere, my friend,
For here, 'tis naught but show, with little true intent.
But if the view alone doth please thee, then by all means,
Prepare thy purse, and suffer their pretenses."

"Listen, I ain't payin' no $50 for a pedicure. Not ever. And I sure as hell didn't pay it this time neither. We asked how much, I told 'em what I wanted, and the only thing that changed was I decided on French tips instead. If I was gonna spend that kinda cash, I'd go to The Bath House. Now, what got me was why they were moppin' the floor at 9 am. Salon just opened, who wants to be there while they're cleanin' up yesterday's mess?"

Thus did we come upon a Thursday eve,
A night most strange, and full of woe,
Our band of men, nine in all, did gain entry free,
By some strange chance, or so it seemed to me.

My first time in Las Vegas, a city bright,
And first club visit, with anticipation great,
But alas, the place did have a deadly feel,
As if none there did truly wish to revel.

The outdoor patio, up above, the only space,
Did hold the crowd, a mix of young and old,
With cougars and manthers, in a lonely race,
Did seek to find some mirth, their hearts cold.

One bar alone, did serve the multitude,
O'erwhelmed it was, with drinks untold,
A sorry sight, and cause for much dismay,
Did leave us all, in sorrow's sway.

Never again, have I returned to this place,
With memories of joy, forever effaced.

"Service was decent, but the grub wasn't great. I had the Tuscana Sausage Soup, which was too salty and the potatoes were undercooked. The sausage was alright, though. I tried building my own pasta, thinking it'd be a better option than pizza, but I was wrong. I got spaghetti with bologonese sauce, meatballs, and mushrooms. It cost around $22-$24, but it wasn't worth it. The pasta and sauce were just lukewarm, and the meatballs tasted like they were straight from the freezer. All in all, I wasn't impressed with the pasta. Maybe I'll stick to a slice of pizza next time."

"This joint wasn't my cup of tea. I dig the retro vibe, but this place was just a dump. Not cheap either, and the burgers were subpar. Awkward setup, hard to get a refill on your soda. Tourists keep it afloat, they don't know any better. I won't be back."
"Rude waitress. Food mediocre, but not worth a single star. First and last visit. Better options nearby, cheaper too. Only plus: veggie options on menu."

"I tried twice to reach Sherry's Pampered Pets by phone, but no one picked up. I left a message, but they never called back. After waiting a few days, I gave up and made reservations elsewhere. If they couldn't be bothered to return my call, I sure wasn't going to leave my dog in their care."

"Stayed at a crummy joint for a night. Decided to go cheap, but it was all show and no go. Beautiful from the outside, but inside it was old and grimy. Service was terrible too. Asked for a non-smoking room, but it reeked of smoke. Called down to the manager's desk, but no one helped us. Finally got someone's attention, but she was rude and sent us to the other side of the lobby. Had to wait 10 minutes for someone to help us, and even then, they told us to go back to the other side. Long desk, especially with two full bottles in my bag. Overall, bad customer service. Maybe if we had arrived an hour earlier, it wouldn't have been so bad. But still, wouldn't stay there again unless I really had to."

"Chopstix, a name that rings of authenticity, but don't be fooled. The service is as fake as the smiles of the staff. I ventured in, hungry for some decent Chinese grub, but what I got was a taste of disappointment. The card reader was busted, so I had to trek to the nearest ATM, shelling out an extra three bucks for the pleasure. I returned, cash in hand, ready to devour my wor wonton soup, house fried rice, and orange chicken. But alas, the man behind the counter was too busy taking a personal call to bother with me. I waited, patiently at first, but as the minutes ticked by, my hunger turned to frustration. Finally, another man sauntered over, sans apology or acknowledgement of my wait, and took my payment. No discount, no freebies, nothing but a bland, unfulfilling experience. Save your taste buds, folks. Chopstix ain't worth the trip."
"Nah. Not worth it. Vegas has better buffets - Wicked Spoon, Bacchanal. This one's a dud. Dry food, sitting out too long, and it attracts the wrong crowd. You're in Vegas, splurge on the good stuff."

"Service was adequate. Menu options were overpriced. I ordered the street-style pork sandwich. Pork was blue rare. Sandwich was small, like a biscuit. Underwhelming experience. I also had a pork taco with green salsa. Pork was cooked well, but taco was soggy from pork grease. Friend had dim sum, no issue with size. Dim sum had an odd smell, but tasted fine. Place was sub-par. Wouldn't go again. Drinks come in small bottles, no free refills. Some bottles are smaller than others. Not worth the money. Wouldn't recommend."

"Hark, our first visit doth unfold,
A tale of service most divine,
Our waitress, friendly and bright,
Didst make our stay most pleasant and light.
The location, priceless indeed,
Westgate, a place of mirth and good deed.
Alas, the pizza, a disappointment true,
Tasting of frozen fare, meager and new.
The sauce, a grossness did impart,
The crust, too thin and soft of heart.
A shame, for such a place of renown,
The pizza should be far better known."
"Staff unimpressive. Food, just okay. Overpriced. Trying too hard to be upscale, but falling short. Limited wine list, small portions, and snobby staff. Better options in Charlotte."

"Been meaning to hit this joint for a bit. Now that I have, I'm good. 

It's the kind of spot you hit after a night of drinking, when your standards ain't so high. It wasn't all that bad, but not great either.  

I gauge Latin eats by their chips and salsa. If it's not good, I know what to expect from the kitchen. With that said..
the chips were greasy, salsa tasted like Pace. 

Had the two taco plate - grilled chicken and steak tacos with re-fried beans and rice. Steak taco had good flavor, but the chicken was real dry. Added lime and salsa to try and juice it up. All in all...it was decent, but not any better quality than a late night taco stand."

"Stayed here last year on a family road trip. Enjoyed it. Room and bathroom were clean. Convenient location, close to I-77 and a great mall. Returned this year, but room wasn't as clean. Hair on the floor, noisy AC kept us up. Staff still friendly, but might look elsewhere next time."

"Cool joint, good hood vibe. But the grub? Bland city. Store-bought chips for dips? Gimme a break. Kiddie mac 'n cheese? Gritty, tasteless. Chicken in the salad? Overcooked, unseasoned. Arugula piled high on my pie? No thanks, pal."

"Food's still great, price is right. But, man, the place is crawlin' with douche bags now. Heard some fatty talkin' 'bout how he scored a table for four for under thirty bucks. Thought to myself, uh-oh, trouble's brewin'. Got there around one twenty, usually it's dead, just a few students or a couple finishin' off their lunch. Now it's packed with soccer moms and cheapskates who found it on Facebook or Yelp. They're makin' it tough to get a table, ruinin' the joint. Tell 'em to knock it off, will ya?"
"Reservations unavailable post five. No phone charging station, bloody hell. Waitress, top-notch. New barkeep, slow as molasses. Dreams took an age. Won't return past five, that's certain."

"Pizza joint claims to have vegan menu, but after 10:30pm, not a single vegan option to be found. Every other pizza available, but not a single one for us plant-eaters. Feels like they're just pretending to care about our business. No offer to make a vegan pizza, even when asked. Shoddy customer service, if you ask me. Feeling mighty disappointed."

"I'll return for a must-see band, elsewise, no dice. 

Security's cool, helped my buddy propose, no issues there. 

Parking's a bitch, limited spots, pricey too. Get there early or you're screwed. 

Sound's mediocre, not the best, not the worst either. 

Drinks? Ripoff! Don't drink, come drunk, or sneak some in. (Not advocating for sneaking it in, but they do pat you down at the door.) 

In summary, this joint's a ripoff, but it's the only game in town for big acts. Screw it."

"Methinks I do adore the notion of delectable, wholesome fare. Four times didst I venture forth to yon establishment, hoping against hope that they might provide a satisfactory repast. Alas, fate didst conspire against me. The first time, the victuals were palatable, but the service, alack, was woeful. Upon my second visit (ere the sun had dipped beneath the horizon on a Friday eve), lo and behold! They had exhausted their store of flat bread. Pray tell, what eatery doth run out of a staple item ere the evening had truly begun? We made do with bbq beef sandwiches, verily, yet the sweet potato fries, alas, were burnt to a crisp. Aye, 'twas a sorry sight indeed. My third visit didst yield more of the same. And thus, upon my fourth attempt, I didst decide to partake of their morning fare. An hour past the appointed hour, the portal stood ajar, nary a sign of a breakfast menu in sight, nor a soul to greet me. The staff, they didst espy me, yet didst ignore me for a full four minutes. As I didst depart, one of them didst bid me 'good morrow', alas, too little, too late."

"Einstein's bagels, now those are something special. Been here a few times, and I gotta say, they're top-notch. Sure, Bruegger's has decent sandwiches, but their bagels can't compare. You can find better bread and bagels elsewhere, easy."

"Greek restaurants should be off-limits to corporations. Family-owned, with hairy, ugly Greeks running the show - that's how I like 'em. There's probably an inverse relationship between the quality of the grub and the looks of the owner. Remember that movie about fat Greeks who ran a diner? Yeah, like that. Anyway, Daphne's is Exhibit A. Craving meat, bread, and fries, I strolled in. My gyro? More like styrofoam. Cold, flavorless meat, and the pita was like a rotten Frisbee. Crumbly, man. The fries were hot, but you could taste the freezer bag. Only bright spot was the diet Soba grapefruit drink. Now that was tasty."

"Terrible service, decent drinks. Booked a table five days in advance, no answer, so gave up. Called back two days later, confirmed high table by window. Arrived on time, table given to someone else, no acknowledgment. Four walk-ins arrived after us, got served first. Took 40 minutes for drinks, 10 minutes for snacks. Server was nice, but arrived 25 minutes in. Would have walked if not for the voucher. Friend had horror stories of bad service."

"A bar most curious, where fortune doth play a part,
In choice of bartender, a matter of the heart.
Some nights, a skilled hand doth pour the draught with grace,
Whilst others, a laggard doth mar the drink's embrace.
I shall not name the culprit, lest I cause offense,
But on certain eves, best to avoid the place, my friend."

"Good people, good vibes. BAM, pickling factory smell, but don't worry, fun bar. Bad experience though - undercooked noodles in ramen, made me feel sick. Small person, but can still eat. Spinach, refreshing. Carrots, lovely. Pork, cold, but good. Nori, standard. Broth, salty, but good. Tried Pai Ton, tonkotsu broth without pork. Friendly staff, made us non-alcoholic shots. Super nice, but food doesn't agree with me. If sensitive, try Cherry Blossom Noodle Cafe, more classic and authentic."

Upon mine arrival, high expectations didst spring,
As tales of this place had oft been told and sung.
The decor and ambiance didst please mine eye,
But alas, the pizza didst not meet mine expectations nigh.

Thin crust, it was, and difficult to consume,
For toppings didst slide off with ease, 'twas no boon.
And cheesy bread, I didst prefer Little Caesar's fare,
To this, which left me in a state of disrepair.

The waitress, kind she was, but long didst disappear,
Leaving me in want of her gentle cheer.
Yet still, I wouldst give this place another chance,
For calzones, they didst seem most delectable and grand.

"Thursday night, busy as hell. My date and I hit up this joint, hoping for some decent grub. We get seated quick, no complaints there. But the food? Not so much. My date's chili was drowning in cheese, tasted like spicy marinara with beans. I went for the beef stroganoff, big mistake. It was swimming in oil, made me feel like I had a grease fire in my gut. Maybe I'll give their burgers a shot next time."

"A friend raved about this joint for six months, so I had to check it out. Turkey sandwich was just okay. But let me tell you, they don't even have Sweetener for their unsweetened iced tea. What a bummer. Not worth my time."

"This joint used to be alright. But, last time I was here for lunch, it was a bust. Server was jabbering to his pals about how crappy the tip was from the table before me. And they were out of the two drinks I wanted. Not going back."

"Celebrated my birthday at this joint and the service was top-notch. But the grub? Not worth the scratch. Ribeye, pork, bone marrow, and a couple glasses of vino set me back $250 for two. Skip it. Head to Bobby Flay's for a better steak and a fairer price."

"Airport's clean, but it's a den of sin. Booze, gambling, and likely strippers too. Plenty of grub, always neat, and easy to navigate. Give it five stars, except for the damn taxi line. It's a mile long and moves at a snail's pace. Unacceptable, especially since the casinos can't seem to fix it. They should be ashamed. Get your act together, airport."

"Two stars, fair enough. Motel 6, upgraded to here, but only by one. Bathroom, needs work. Deep cleaning, once in a while, and we're talking a full star more. Rooms, big, balcony, nice. Pool, hot tub, good, but clear out the debris, you know? Service, friendly, helpful. Breakfast, fine. Clean up, Windemere, and you're close."

"Ate at this joint years back, inside the Mirage. Good grub, we thought. Recently, though, it was piss poor. Server didn't know squat about the soup du jour. Nutty broad, too. Made us feel rushed. Food? Shit, it was cold. Sent it back. Prices? Outta whack for the crap they serve. Too many better spots in Vegas. Won't be comin' back."
"Food's good, but service is a bust. Last time, waited 30 minutes, not a single server in sight. Left and hit up another joint. Now, we just call in for wings and grab 'em to go."

"Ay, 'twas a disappointment indeed,
For one accustomed to the finest feed,
In New York's steakhouses, where the beef doth reign,
This place did falter, and my hopes were vain.

With a party of ten, we didst sit down,
To partake in their midday repast, profound.
The menu, full of promise, didst delight,
But alas, my steak, it was not quite right.

Overcooked, it was, and lacking grace,
A sorry sight, upon my plate's face.
And where, oh where, didst the porterhouse steaks go?
I searched the menu, but they didst not show.

The wine, a solace, yet a costly affair,
Even in Vegas, where riches do pour.
So, in conclusion, this place didst not win,
My heart, nor stomach, with its culinary sin."

"Ew. Flavorless canned mushrooms and frozen spinach in my omelet. No seasoning, just a big sloppy mess. Took forever to take our order, much less get it to us. Hash browns were okay, but that's about it. Don't understand the high reviews."

"A single bad attitude can ruin a good experience. That's what happened at 360 Physical Therapy. I was set to give them a great review, but their strict cancellation policy and a disagreement over a missed appointment led to a battle with their billing manager. Despite being a responsible customer, always on time and paying upfront, they wouldn't budge. It's too bad, because I liked my therapist and felt well cared for. But their inflexibility turned a positive experience sour. It's a shame, as I would have returned and recommended them to others. Instead, I'll think twice before going back."
"Place was a dump, real sketchy. Rented some skates, moldy as hell. Only rink in Madison, so not like we had choices. Kids didn't seem to care, still had fun. We dealt with it."

"Hark! I didst recent visit Frank and Lupes,
Where food was plentiful and most delectable,
But alas! Service didst leave much to be desired,
For our waiter didst not come to our table,
And we didst have to journey to the bar,
To fetch our own drinks, which didst seem quite odd.

And at the end of dinner, my companion didst rise,
To use the restroom, leaving me alone,
And lo! Our waiter didst approach me then,
Asking if I didst await to be seated,
As if he hadst not attended me for nigh on two hours,
A strange and curious thing, indeed!"

"The MarchÃ© Bonsecours, a beautiful building, sure. But that's where my admiration ends. Inside, it's all too polished, catering to rich tourists only. They claim to showcase local artists, but it all blends together and costs a pretty penny. Go for a visit, but don't expect to be impressed by the architecture."

"Been here twice. First time, liked the menu, had lunch. Food was good, standard bar fare. Service was decent, not too busy. Found out they got UFC fights, so went back for that. Fight night, they hit us with a $10 cover charge. What the hell? Everywhere else in EV, it's five bucks. Already there, so we stayed. Waitress asks for credit card or ID as security. Are you kidding me? We're a couple of forty-somethings. You think we're gonna dine-and-dash? Reluctantly gave her my card. Fights started, but not all the TVs were tuned in. Had to crane my neck. Even after the game ended, they didn't switch 'em. Food was okay, service was good. Go back for grub, but not for UFC. Stickin' with Old Chicago or Tilted Kilt for that."

"Burritos do the trick when I'm stuck at work, cravin' breakfast. Use 'em every couple weeks or so. Service, though? Horrible. Always get put on hold, never get picked up. Call back, finally get my order in. If there was another joint that delivered, I'd be gone."
"Crappy joint, this hotel. Room's a mess, dust everywhere. Missing stuff, like cups and laundry bags. Bed sheet's filthy, bloodstained too. Had to get housekeeping to swap 'em out."
"Beer selection limited. Tap labels, just words. Claims, empty. We sought more, found better up the street."
"Slow service at this EB. Slower than others. Going to the one on Sahara next time, even though it's a bit further away."
"Thai food, mediocre. Lunch special, $7.99. Till 4 pm. Service, average. Won't be back."

"Hark! A tale of woe doth come from yonder tavern,
Where I didst partake in a midday repast.
A chicken Caesar salad burrito, my heart didst crave,
Yet, alas! My order was amiss, twice now, 'twain.

In error, I didst assume a Caesar salad doth lack
Tomatoes, those juicy red orbs that doth besmirch
My meal with their soggy presence. Alas, I do confess,
I love ketchup, but tomatoes, no, they doth not impress.

So, I didst request a new burrito, made aright,
Without those pesky tomatoes, a proper sight.
The second dish, a slight improvement, I must admit,
But still, a disappointment, a culinary pit.

Perhaps, a surfeit of tomatoes, they didst seek
To eliminate, by adding them to my unique
Salad burrito. Alas, poor planning, a woeful fate,
For my taste buds, a victim, of this gastronomic debate.

Oh, Costa Vida, a place of renown,
Crowded, indeed, yet worth the wait, I have found.
But alas, my burrito cravings, they didst betray,
And led me to this tavern, on this fateful day."

"My daughter and I went on a mission to get fresh bagels. We copped some from a spot in Montreal, but they didn't impress. They were thin and a bit too sweet for my taste. I'm a New York bagel man myself, and I've been known to go the distance for 'em. The sesame bagel was alright, but the rest were stale and day old. We tried a couple different spots, but in the end, we decided Montreal bagels just ain't our thing. I think other Americans who've had the real deal in NYC would agree. And let's be real, I can get better bagels in Boston."

"A new Olive Garden popped up near my place. My husband and I decided to give it another shot, despite our reservations. Big mistake. It was a total letdown. Why do we keep doing this to ourselves? Trust your instincts, right? 

The fried mussels were decent, but nothing special. The chicken alfredo pizza was way too salty. I could barely finish it. I tried dipping it in the chicken and gnocchi soup to tone down the saltiness. But nope, still too much. I should've sent it back, but I've worked in restaurants before. I know what happens to returns. Not worth it... My husband's spaghetti with meat sauce was unremarkable. The herbs and spices were MIA. 

The food only deserves one star, but the service was top-notch. So, I'll give it two stars."

"Food's good, atmosphere's swell. But the service? Forget about it. Cashiers look like they're sucking on a lemon. You'd think they'd crack a smile, but nope. They're as grumpy as a cat in a bathtub."

"Stone Crab and Joe's, good on the right day.  Sat at the bar, Sunday afternoon, great service, good meal.  First visit, recon for a date with the wife.  Went back Thursday night, crab was off, texture strange, tasted like piss.  Waiter, a clumsy oaf.  Should've flipped my plate, spit in his face, walked out without paying.  Caesars, hit or miss, buyer beware."

"I got my first orthotics from this joint back in '01. Felt like royalty, they made me believe they knew their stuff. Paid a hundred and change for two pairs. Went back yesterday, couldn't find my inserts, so I bought some kicks. Six hundred bucks for what I got years ago. Still cost me a C-note though. Asked for slip-resistant, felt like I was at a roller rink in the kitchen. Went back today, some dude with a fake hawk gave me the runaround. Quoted the manufacturer's words like it was scripture. Overpriced, prescribed inserts from some schmuck without a sports med degree? No thanks. Rude treatment too? That's why I'm giving 'em a low score. Should mention the chick I dealt with yesterday was polite, but said their products last five to eight months max. That's crap for a hundred and thirty bucks."

"This joint's owned by Treasure Island, not some corporate bigshot. No fancy perks here, just straight-up coffee. Employees are friendly, but don't expect them to chat all day. No tables or chairs, so grab your cup and go. It's the only Starbucks on the strip now, but don't get your hopes up for a spiritual awakening with your morning joe."
"Starving, we tried this joint. Shouldn't have. Food was meh, overpriced, and no Ritas. Not even a variety. Just some chick named Rita. Disappointment all around. No live tunes or atmosphere either."
"Coffee, sweetened. Simple request, no? Yet, they managed to botch it. Rock sugar, unmelted. A travesty. Disappointment, pure and simple."

"Atmosphere's decent, good for a drink or two. Grub's alright, but overpriced for what you get. Irish Pasty's mostly spuds, some cabbage, a bit of cheese, and a tiny bit of corned beef. Cornish Pasty at Guad/Dobson's way better. Rest of the menu's your typical strip mall bar food. Coulda been anywhere else and had the same experience. Good for a drink, not much else."

"The dimly lit room impressed us. Bread basket came first, with Asiago roll, walnut and cranberry bread, and a French roll. We both ordered broiled walleyed pike, which was a bit dry, and shared a baked potato (overcooked) and creamed corn. Finished with a crÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e. The creamed corn, served in a large casserole dish and broiled, was the best part of the meal. The crÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e, unfortunately, was one of the worst we've ever had. Twenty years have passed since we last dined at this restaurant, but it's improved with age, lacking in ambiance but making up for it with friendly staff and reasonable prices. Ms. Westie's 8-ounce filet was good, but not quite prime, served medium rare as requested. My Chilean sea bass was cooked to perfection - crispy outside, moist inside, with garlic mashed potatoes, a small fennel salad, and sautÃ©ed spinach."

"Good toppings, great service, cute joint. Beer and wine flights, too. But the dough? Just okay. Expected more crunch, like from a wood oven. Been searching for a place with an egg pizza that brings back memories of Italy. Great toppings, but work on the dough."

"A soiree, by my count, didst take place within these hallowed halls,
And, by the stars, 'twas a sight to behold, so fair and beauteous!
The staff, with smiles and grace, didst tend to our each whim,
But, alack, for those who doth eschew the flesh of beasts,
There was little to savor, save a few meager morsels.
The kitchen, too, didst disappoint, despite their store of fine ingredients,
For they didst not strive to fashion a salad most excellent."

"Tired from a day of tourist traps, we returned to our dive hotel, the LVH. Too exhausted to venture out for dinner, we gave their in-house restaurant a shot. Greeted promptly, we were seated without delay. But, trust the other reviews, and avoid this joint like the plague. On a Sunday night, the place was dead, save for two other tables, and the soundtrack of Motley Crue music videos blasting loud. Vince Neil, sure, but this was excessive. Our server, attentive, as expected, given the lack of patrons. Food? Bland, at best. Chips and salsa, straight from the supermarket. Fish tacos, fried or microwaved. Beef "machaca" tacos, cold, mushy mess. We were tired, it was edible, no one got sick, so I guess that's something. In conclusion, steer clear of this restaurant, and the LVH altogether. New management is running the place into the ground, both figuratively and literally."

"Honey Bears ain't my cup of tea, friend. Been there twice 'cause I'm a sucker for BBQ, but it just don't cut it. Sauce is more like broth, lackin' that smoky kick. Meat's alright, though - had some good pork and chicken. But them sides? Forget about it. Potato salad's as dull as a butter knife. Overall, stick to the meat, but there's better BBQ in Phoenix."

"Skip Scottsdale. Stay elsewhere, gamble here. Pool's mediocre. Restaurants are meh, except Orange Sky - felt like a carnival cruise with tatted-up dudes and stiletto-clad teens. Save your cash, gamble, and bunk elsewhere."

"Excited, I was. Saw the 'Coming Soon' sign, I did. Twice, I've been there. Not going back, I am. Food, not bad, it's true. But overall, unsatisfactory, my experience was. Overpriced, they are. Stingy, I tell ya. Hate 'em, I do. Pollo a la Brasa', I ordered. Fries, they did not give. False advertising, it is. Cheap, they are. Yuca fries, don't order. Six bucks, it costs. Five fries, you'll get. Strange looks, the waitress gave. Insane, I must be. Minimal tip, I would've given. Back, I won't go. Business, poorly run, it is."

"Alas, this place doth lack the sweetest brew,
A sorrowful sight, indeed, for me.
For in the hours of joy and mirth,
Beer doth flow like a bounteous sea.

But nay, not here, where I do find
No special draughts to quench my thirst.
And thus, my friends, I must confess,
Maggiano's doth lose its former zest.

Five times have I graced its halls,
Yet now, the fare doth falter, falls.
Alas, how swiftly doth it decline,
Leaving me to pine for pasta divine.

Yet still, I hold dear the Italian feast,
And dream of fresh pasta, wine, and bread,
To make at home, a merry treat,
And savor each bite with joy and cheer."

"Went to this joint on a Sunday, around three. Ordered a salad to go. Gal said it was big, I asked what greens they used. It wasn't big and they skimped on the greens. Better to get a salad bar, save some cash and get more food. Asked about dressing, they said I didn't specify. Never got asked about my dressing choice. Didn't get free ice cream either, like some other guy did. Asked about crackers, they said no. Grabbed some from the salad bar on my way out. Salad was good, but not what the menu promised."

"Dropped the car off Saturday, sputtering like a sonofabitch. Three calls, no callback. Monday afternoon, they finally rang up, said they jiggled some wires, test-drove it, all good. But if that damn light pops on again, bring it back. Sure enough, next day, light's on, dropped it off Monday night. Now it's Tuesday arvo, not a peep from them. Communication's crap, two days and they still can't figure out what's wrong? Unacceptable. Even if they fix it today, gotta keep it another day or two. Wouldn't be so bad if they just kept us in the loop, even once. Now we're taking the car and bailing. Don't bother with Fletcher's, they don't give a damn about keeping you updated."

"Been goin' to Lee Lee's for years, but it's gone downhill lately. Ethnic sections still got some variety, but Japanese foods ain't gettin' restocked regular. Never been their strong suit, but they had the basics. Me, bein' Japanese, relied on that section. Now it's just a bunch of Kirkland seaweed takin' up space. Sure, I get seaweed from CostCo sometimes, but when I'm cookin' up some good rice, I want the real deal - thicker, more flavorful Japanese brands. Their rice selection's all but disappeared too. Guess I'll have to find a new spot."

"Food's good, but there's a couple things that bug me. First, the milkshakes ain't mixed right. You gotta mash 'em up or wait till they melt. Don't like that. Second, the service is slow. Been here four times, different times of day, and it's always the same story. Gotsta flag down the waiter for refills and beg for the check. Food's good, but that's about it."
"Food's good. Service too, when they ain't slammed. But I'm really in it for the apps and cold ones during happy hour."
"Thursday, May 1st, 2014. Two girls working. One reluctant, one seated. Reluctant one helped, begrudgingly. Followed us, hurrying our order. Bad service, great ice cream."
"Disappointment hit hard when I found out they didn't stock yard art or Talavera pottery. Always on the lookout for unique touches."

"Went to The Vig, been there before, good grub, nice patio, decent service. Went back, different story. Me and the boys stood at the host stand, nobody greeted us, servers just chillin' at the door. We grabbed a table, reserved signs everywhere, expected someone to seat us. Server comes up, asks if we walked in, if we need menus. Sure, we say. She says the table's reserved, but any other table's fine, she'll be right back. Found another table, guy from the big party tells us that one's reserved too. Feel like staff wasn't paying attention to anyone else. Left feeling frustrated and impatient. Hope it's a one-time thing, The Vig's usually better than that, don't wanna miss their good food."

"Parking should be free. It'd liven up this joint, make it more worthwhile. When it first opened, folks from all over came to check it out, shop, eat. Now? It's just a bunch of chain stores and mediocre restaurants. But hey, happy hour specials are still good. That's one thing they got right."

"The theatre's not bad. Seats are comfy, stage's a bit small, but drinks are decent, price-wise. Woulda given 'em four stars, easy, but then I went for improv and all I heard was Tabu's bass thumpin' away next door. Unbelievable. My show started at 11:30, and the noise was constant. Gave me a damn headache, and my husband's seat was shakin'. Big distraction from an otherwise great show. Worth every penny, but for that racket? Nah, I'll be lodgin' a complaint."

"Dim Sum's no good. This joint's better, but that ain't sayin' much. Frozen dishes, not fresh. Bland dim sum, not much variety. Can't expect Charlotte to have the same quality as big cities, but I do expect the classics like chicken feet and shrimp rice noodles to be decent. They're not. If you're lookin' for good dim sum, drive to Atlanta."

"Combos at Za's come with a twist - one item's always off. Like the buffalo chicken salad I ordered, topped with fried chicken that felt like rubber. My friend's apple gorgonzola salad was drowning in iceberg lettuce. But Za's redeems itself with a selection of Cheesecake Factory treats. Perfect for days when you need a little indulgence to forget the blues."
"Excalibur for cheap digs. Tropicana? Skip it. Went there a couple years back. Adequate. Last week? Super gross."

"Burgers were decent, not the best I've had, but worth the dough. Server was friendly, checked in often. Atmosphere was meh, too twangy for my taste. Lots of pool tables, some bigger games, plenty of TVs. But nobody cleans the tables, had to wipe down my own mess."
"Food unimpressive. Overpriced. Won't be back on my dollar."

"Sephora mini, inside JCPENNEY's lower level, near mall entrance. Good thing, saves time. Inventory's limited, only popular items and basics. Great they have Sephora though. F grade customer service. Five sales reps, two busy, three just standing there. Personal business. Invisible coat, had to squeeze through to check fragrances. None acknowledged me. Wanted Tocca, didn't see it, knew they carried it at Town Square Sephora. Potential $100 sale lost. Employees might be JCP affiliated, check the tapes, see how 'helpful' they are."

"Methought we'd try a mobile groomer for our pup,
A Bolognese of eight summers, blind, alack!
Twas stressful taking her to groomers, loud and rough,
And ours of six years didst flake, most uncouth.

I called Green Dog, a company of great renown,
Their reviews didst prompt me, left a message down.
I gave my number, asked when they could come,
But nary a word, a full day hath passed, 'twas done.

I tried again, voice mail, a hang-up, alas!
Twenty-four hours, a lengthy wait, methinks, for a new guest.
I shall seek elsewhere, though their praise didst gleam,
For promptness, it doth seem, doth not their business beam."

"Birthday dinner for Mom at some joint, forget the name. Place was dead, just us and the staff. Started with calamari, too much breading, couldn't taste the squid. Risotto Milanese, that was good. Service went downhill from there. Told 'em it was a birthday dinner, expected something small, got tiramisu instead. Order all your desserts, don't count on freebies. Didn't even get my doggie bag, guy said he'd take care of it, then disappeared. Won't be back. Two stars, decent food, crummy service."

"Fare thee well, dear gourmand! Forsooth, the victuals served within these hallowed halls be but mediocre, o'erpriced forsooth! The servers, they doth stumble, forgetful of the orders placed before them. Fie upon this "American brasserie"! 'Tis naught but feeble French, a pale imitation of the true cuisine of Gaul. Alas, the fare be not wondrous, merely passable, a sorry state of affairs indeed. Yet, praise be given for the ambiance fair, the mixed potions, strong and true. Alack, a restaurant in a noble hostelry, near the stages of the city, doth falter. Methinks, a grievous error, a blot upon the name of Pittsburgh, fair city of the west!"
"Downtown's your best bet. I stick with buffalo shrimp, but the coating here's too thick. Ice tea's got a dirt taste and service is crap."
"Wings and beers, good. Burgers, no. Flavorless, uninteresting. Big portions, ridiculous. Service, good. Go back for beer and apps, yes."

"Alas, my friends, I must report,
The food at this place did not comport,
With the high praise that Yelp did bring,
A disappointment, indeed, it did sting.

Chicken satay, dry and overcooked,
Basil fried rice, mushy and oversauced,
Shrimp and chicken, scarce and small,
A heavy hand, their flavors did dull.

But wait, there was a dish, a gem,
A stir fry, with black bean and ginger,
The best of all, a taste most fine,
A saving grace, for this poor repast.

Yet, alas, the price did cause dismay,
One app and two entrees, thirty dollars they did say,
A steep sum, for a meal not quite grand,
A pity, for a restaurant, once so bland."

Breakfast brought us naught but standard fare,
Fried rice and strange "breakfast" dishes there.
Lunchtime came, and lo, the same again,
Fried chicken joined the menu, but in vain.
Dinner offered slight improvement, 'twain,
But stale food all day left us in disdain.
Alack, the buffet's faults we did proclaim,
Cheap and easy, yet our bellies did bemoan.
In hindsight, dear friends, we should have sought
Decent victuals, and not the buffet's thought.
For though the food was not utterly vile,
Stale meals thrice a day did our bellies soil.

"Walking through the Mirage, my wife and I stumbled upon this restaurant. It looked great, so we gave it a shot. Big sushi fans, we were let down. Pricey and unoriginal. Calamari was alright, but not worth it. Three rolls, all disappointing. Closed out the bill, still hungry. Don't waste your time if you're looking for real sushi. San Diego spoils us, maybe. Won't be back."

"Food was alright. Decor was swell, but the tunes killed the vibe. They should stick to instrumental chill music, ya know? Ciabatta chicken sandwich was just okay. Bread didn't have that classic ciabatta taste. Sweet potato fries were a bit soggy. Hummus was decent, but the pita had a raw taste."

"This joint's got everything - bowling, pool, grub, and games. But let me tell you, it ain't exactly kid-friendly. It's wide open, no barriers to keep the little ones from wandering off. Safety's a concern, especially if you got multiple rugrats. Parents gotta keep a close eye, but that's tough when there's too many kiddos to watch. 

Another thing, they don't got much in the way of classic arcade games. Most of 'em are violent or ticket-based, neither of which is good for youngins. 

And let's not forget, the games that dole out tickets? That's just a slippery slope into gambling. Paying to play games of chance for a prize? No thanks. I steer the kiddos towards games that'll be fun regardless of the tickets. 

So yeah, kids might like the place, but I ain't a fan."

"Hark, good sir! My review doth focus solely on the service provided, forsooth. The cashier, alack, didst possess not an iota of charm or verve, his visage dour and uninviting. His voice, too, didst lack luster, a dreary tone that didst bespeak his disinterest in his work. In stark contrast, the manager, a merry soul, didst present my repast with a grin and a jest, a bright spot on an otherwise lackluster morn. Pray, let this employee take heed and learn from his superior, that he may spread joy and positivity, ere the day doth fully bloom."
"Enchiladas, ruined. Soggy tortillas drowned in a pool of horror. No taste, just mole overload. Disappointed."

"Farewell, dear grey heads, Mia Bella Cafe doth leave me unimpressed, a mediocre meal at best, while others sang its praise. I entered the empty hall, devoid of folk, at half past eleven. My hunger craved a light repast, but lo, the shawarma's siren call did tempt me, and I yielded. A wrap it was, with naught but dry potatoes beside, and a panini, drenched in Israeli dressing, ruining the bread, alas. Disappointment doth be my verdict, friends, forsooth, I shall not return."

"Wife and I hit up this joint for V-Day dinner. Not your average day, I know. Here's my take...\n\nReserved for 7:30, didn't sit down 'til 9. By then, I was fuming, starving, and not feeling like shelling out for some mediocre lamb. Food was meh, tables too close together, and we were near the kitchen with a damn pillar in my way. Maybe the window seats are better, but I won't be going back to find out."

"Dive, through and through. Rounded down from 2.5, but that's what it is. Not a place for a night out, more like a last resort at 4 am. Cash only, no separate checks. Food's alright, like something a mom who can't cook would make. Don't wanna be too harsh, but it's the truth. Waitresses are friendly, dressed in scrubs like nurses."

Saturday night, 9 PM, we walked into the joint. Busy, but the service was decent. Big menu, mostly bar food. My girl got a taco salad, greasy shell and all. I went for the club sandwich, fries, and a cup of chili. Fries were crispy, homemade. Club wasn't toasted, no spread. Chili was good. Prices were a bit steep, but it's Cave Creek, you know?
"Decent grub, but no sports package? Forget it. I'll find better places to grab a burger and catch a game."

"Pure was a bust from the start. Waited over an hour to get in, even with six women and three men in our group. They griped about the ratio, but it didn't seem to stop them from flooding in. Inside, the floor was tacky and the staff sluggish. Bartenders, too. Only upsides were the rooftop lounge and the fifty bucks I scored from some big spender in the VIP section. Wouldn't pay to get in again, but hey, fifty bucks ain't bad."

"Friendly waitstaff, always a pleasure. Free popcorn and cheap drinks, can't complain. TV setup could be better, but not a big deal. Cole slaw? Don't think I'll be touching that again after what I heard. Not gonna say any more about it."

"In town, Lakers too. BF, friend, and me tried for tix from a scalper. Didn't know the joint, got ripped off. Ended up with tickets to some dump called Verve Lounge. It's like a dive bar between the cheap seats and the good stuff. Nowhere to sit, crappy view. Not worth it. I'd rather sit in the rafters or be at Staples altogether."

"Firefly's a joint for the hip, not the hungry. Loud, crowded. Menu's tame, nothing too wild. Fries were alright, mac and cheese too. Grouper? Dry, plain. Salad, okay. Empanadas, small. Albondigas, flavorless meatballs. Paella, the best thing, but still, not the greatest."

"Lobster Pot Pie and Shrimp Scallops, crab cakes too. Presentation neat, taste not so much. Flavors off, overall a letdown. Service trying but failing. Been to better dinners in Vegas, this one a disappointment. Cost not worth it, Ramsay's better."

Sitting in Platoâ€™s Closet, waiting for them to go through my clothes. Five associates, three customers, and not a single greeting. Had to stand at the counter for five minutes before someone finally approached me, and even then, it was with a scowl. Great selection, but the vibe is off-putting. Sign says â€œlike us on Facebook,â€ but I wonâ€™t be doing that. After today, Iâ€™ll take my business elsewhere. Buffalo Exchange is more my speed. Spreading the word about this place.

"Sunday night, went in for a meal. Bad move. Food was subpar, even for a chain Italian joint. Service was good though, sat at the bar and caught the game. Can't quite pinpoint what was off - the grub, the menu, or something else."

"Sura's Korean BBQ, a joint I've been meaning to try. Buffet style, pick your meats, bring 'em back to the table, grill 'em up. Server'll get you drinks, clean your grill now and again. Food's not half bad, but not great either. Middle of the tray, you might find some frozen meat. 

Went to the can while I was there, saw an employee leave the stall without washing her hands. Next thing I know, she's behind the buffet line, serving up meat. True story. 

Made me sick to my stomach. Wanted to go back to the stall, puke my guts out. AYCE menu's around the same price as the other places in town? No thanks, not after what I saw in the restroom."

"Fringe, International, and Film Festivals, I comprehend, my good fellow,

Book Festival, a tad excessive, doth seem to me.

Politics Festival? Pray tell, what mirth doth it bring?

Politics, in sooth, a vital matter, no doubt, 
Yet a festival, forsooth, doth it not make. A crowd of hippies, foul-smelling, in a circle sit, 
Glued to their seats, discussing taxes, capital gains, quoth the Bard. 
Next, the Festival of Accountancy, doth await."

"This joint thinks it's a spa? It's got another thing coming. Waited 20 minutes to be seated, then told to move. Nail tech barely spoke to me, too busy chatting with everyone else in a language I couldn't understand. They've got a sign threatening to charge you if you break one of their old bottles. Place is a dump, but somehow they're still busy. Got my nails done for $15, but I won't be back."

I stepped into the shop, empty but for a lone sleeper. I took a quiet peek, confirming my suspicion. A man snoozed on the couch, oblivious to my presence. I left him be, pocketing a few cards and making mental notes of their wares. Drip tips, batteries, and unfamiliar liquids piqued my interest. I'll return in a few days, hoping for a more fruitful visit. The store seemed cozy, with a display case brimming with flavors. A couple caught my eye, but I couldn't sample them. Disappointment lingers, tainting my rating - 2/5 stars.

"Went to the coffee shop yesterday, around six. Place was dead, just me and the cashier. She wasn't exactly friendly, just said "hold on" when I tried to order. Finally got my tea, but she left the tea bag in the cup on the counter while she made some other drinks. Not exactly sure why she couldn't just put the hot water in my cup. Maybe it's just me, but I think she could've done better. Will probably come back though, it's one of the only coffee shops near my house."

"I showed up for my appointment with Doc Meghan, but she didn't bother to show. Said she was sick. Everyone gets sick, but that ain't the point. Front desk girl Judy had a sour face, like she was doing me a favor by breathing. Unprofessional, through and through. Heard her talking trash to the techs, saying I was a pain in the ass and gave her attitude. Bullshit. Patients shouldn't be treated like this. I got to my appointment on time, waited an hour to be seen. Doc Michaels and his assistant, though, they were top-notch. Judy needs a refresher course on how to treat people with respect. The other girls there, too. They need to keep their yaps shut, 'cause we can all hear 'em."
"Sunday brunch. Western Omelet. Just okay. Others had the buffet. Seemed to like it. Quantity over quality joint. Hashbrown casserole. Tasty."
"Been here thrice. Crowd pleaser, seems. Southern grub, Louisiana style. Gyros, decent. Creole shrimp, fish, too salty, heavy. Soul food fans might dig it. Gets packed at lunch, tight quarters."
"Spicy shrimp, huh? Not on your life. Tasted like a damn kiddie pool. But hey, good times regardless."
"Passable, at best. Real Cajun, it ain't. But, if you're lookin' for somethin' decent, this place'll do. The Rat Toes appetizer, now that's somethin' good."

"Love this Fry's, been coming here since it reopened last year. Spend a pretty penny too. But last time, it was a bust. Got home, missing a few things. Third time this has happened. No apologies from the staff, not even from the assistant manager. Had a better experience at Safeway, bought some shrimp, it was spoiled, brought it back, they gave me double the amount and refunded my cash. That's how you do customer service. Fry's may have good deals, but you can't put a price on good service."
"Surcharge from 9pm to 5am, 25 cents on every damn thing. Open 24 hours, what a joke. They ain't payin' their employees more at night, that's for sure. Bread still tastes great, hot and fresh."

"Food, top-notch. Service, subpar. New Year's Eve, waited twenty minutes for drinks. Server, alright, but slow as hell bringing grub. Asked him, he says, 'Kitchen's backed up, pal.' Not what I expected from a joint like this. Might go back, but why bother when there's better steakhouses in Vegas?"

"Agave? More like Agony. Service was slow as molasses. No hostess, no utensils, no server. Just a whole lotta waiting. Food? Forgettable. Quesadillas were meh, fish tacos were soggy and fishy. Ambiance? Surprisingly decent. But let's be real, I'm here for the grub, not the decor."

"O, woeful day! In Charlotte's bars, I chanced upon the worst of tenders. Slow of hand and rude of demeanor, they botched a simple request. Three ales I ordered, yet three shots of Fireball did they bring. I spoke, aye, did I speak, to the lass, saying, 'Two Hearted Ales, fair maid, are what I seek.' But lo, she vanished, leaving me bereft of brew, despite a barback's words, promising my order's swift return."
"No sign of employees for 10 minutes, then bumped into one. He was helpful."

"Aye, 'twas a sight most curious,
This train station, busy and full of fuss,
In Edinburgh, the capital, they say,
Chaos reigned, like night and day.

I took a taxi, swift and fast,
To journey down to London, at last,
But when I descended underground,
Disorder ruled, all around.

Amenities, there were aplenty,
Pubs and shops, for those who be penny-wise,
But open roofs, a chilly feel,
In Scotland's clime, doth not appeal.

And being from fair California,
Big structures looming, doth make me quake,
Trains on separate tracks, alas,
No other choice, but to take a chance.

Drink or early rising, who can say?
But thus, the travelers find their way."

"Four stars for thee, young bear-stuffing lad,
Whose Converse shoes didst make mine eyes glad.
Thou didst try thy best to keep mine attention,
But alas, my daughter, wild and untamed,
Didst steal the show, with her ADHD ways,
And made it hard for thee to keep thy claim.

At checkout, a star doth deducted lie,
For thou, a lazy fool, didst make a scene,
Yelling loud, like one possessed of thee,
And caused my daughter's wonder and glee.
Thy actions, rude and unbecoming, were,
And made mine husband turn, to see the fray.

Twice, I told thee, quiet, and still,
To put the purse away, and avoid the thrill.
But thou, a stubborn mule, didst not heed,
And caused a scene, most unnecessary and rude.
A mother's tricks, to hide a thing from sight,
Thou shouldst not, with thy yells, ignite.
All thou hadst to do, was put it back,
When we were gone, and save the attack."
"Methinks I do enjoy the rearward space of yonder tavern, forsooth, the melodies do please mine ear. Alas, my sojourn there was brief, yet shall I endeavour to return anon."

"Lived in Vegas my whole life. Been through McCarran a million times. Security lines hellish during peak hours, Friday and Sunday afternoons. Food options decent, few high-end shops. Pray for A or B gates, empty as the Sahara. Big airport, lots of walking. Slot machines and tacky Vegas kitsch everywhere. TSA agents laid back, taxi lines lengthy. Hire a limo, worth the cost. Free Wi-Fi, blessing."

"Methinks I've supped within these walls ere now,
And found it to be most wondrous fair.
But alas, a recent visit with friends,
Didst leave me feeling quite dismayed.

A numerous throng we were, and gathered round,
In yonder bar, where we didst take our stand.
A Monday eve it was, and service slow,
Our server, burdened, didst bear the load.

I called for drink, and waited patiently,
Twenty minutes passed, and still nary a sight.
A comrade, near, didst order victuals too,
And lo, his fare didst come, before mine own.
And we sat close to yonder bar, I swear!

The draught, when came, didst not resemble that,
Which in the menu, hadst been described.
A sweet concoction, in a wine glass, 'twas,
And I, in discontent, didst send it back.
Another drink, I craved, and waited yet,
Fifteen minutes more, ere it didst arrive.

The small plates, dear, and entrees, left much,
To be desired, in truth, they didst not impress.
No dish, save bacon, couldst we find,
And tilapia, at twenty-two, didst seem most unkind.

For brunch, again, I shall return, anon,
But ne'er for dinner, or drinks, I fear, alone."

"This joint's got me down, for two reasons. First, it used to be great, then it took a turn for the worse. Second, they won't let you take your grub to go. What kind of restaurant does that? I went with a buddy, ordered an appetizer and a main course each. The veal was decent, but I couldn't finish it. When we asked for the leftovers to go, the missus gave us a sour face and said no way. That's when I knew I wouldn't be coming back. Don't like feeling ripped off, and not getting my money's worth makes me feel plain rotten."

"Franks A Lot, a humble joint on the east side of the road, caught my eye after driving past it countless times. Tucked away behind the airport, it's easy to miss. But one day, I decided to give it a shot. And let me tell you, it's a gem. Great hot dogs, good price, and friendly folks running the show. It's a family affair, and they do it right. Cash only, but don't worry, your lunch won't break the bank. Their Chicago dog is the real deal, loaded with onions, celery salt, sports peppers, and tomatoes. Get some fresh fries on the side, and you're set. They also serve Polish sausage, cheese fries, and philly cheese steak, but I stick to my Chicago dog. If you're in the area, give it a go."

"Hark! If grandame's mind did burst with creativity on a Sunday eve, 'twould look like this: paints, glues of varied sorts, brushes of all kinds, picture frames in shapes and sizes diverse, arts and crafts of the seasons, beads and bedazzlers aplenty, candles galore, styrofoam in strange forms and blocks, construction paper, wooden shelves to stain or color at will, fake flowers, glass containers, and more! And should thou be enamored of scrap-booking, Michael's shall be thy haven, a veritable dream come true!"
"Tendress was a wretched wench, but her potions were divine. I'd return for the tasty tipples, despite her gruff demeanor."

"First Fridays at Brass turn into a wild scene. I'll be back, that's for sure. Location is everything, and in this case, it's Fremont - above Hennesy's Tavern, to be exact. The joint's got a sweet balcony for all you smokers out there, and it's a great spot to people-watch on Fremont. When you're ready to move on, Beauty Bar, Vanguard, and Insert Coins are just a stone's throw away. \

Music-wise, KidFunk killed it on the decks. He played a solid stream of good tracks, mostly house and tech house, with some electro and dubstep thrown in. The dance floor's decent-sized, and there's another room with a different DJ spinning tunes. Word is, they keep it up, and I'll be making this a regular First Friday stop. \

Now, about those bathrooms - yikes. Filthy doesn't begin to describe 'em. Drinks and who-knows-what all over the floor, and don't even get me started on the toilet paper situation. Grab some paper towels before you do your business, just saying. \

And the gogo dancers? Sorry, guys, but they were a letdown - both in looks and moves. \

No dress code or cover when I went, fellas. Don't forget to rate and follow, eh?"

"I tried this joint despite the reviews. Decor was cool, but the bathroom was weird. Hand dryer's on one faucet, so you gotta wait your turn. Ladies, no sanitary depositories in the stalls. You gotta walk to the main trash to toss your stuff. 

Had the veggie burger. Tasty, but small, like a slider. Fries were good, but normal portion size. Water cups, tiny. Not full after the meal. Ate a medium popcorn at the movies, no problem. 

Don't think this place'll make it. Too pricey for the size. Need bigger portions or lower prices. No option to double up the veggie patty."

"Pub's alright for a beer and grub if you're stuck near the convention center. Been there twice, grad student in town for a conference. JalapeÃ±o poppers and onion rings, good stuff. Buffalo wings, meh. Gets packed during games, but that's part of the fun. So, if you're stranded and hankerin' for a cold one and some snacks, give it a shot."

"A loyal Sakana fan, I was, for many a year,
Until my son's birth did change my cheer.
Going out for sushi, not so easy now,
With a little one, our plans did bow.
But after three years, my love did grow,
And my husband, he did take me slow.
To Sakana, on a date night, we did go,
Wondering, would it still be a show?
Alas, the chefs, not as friendly as before,
Little banter, few recommendations galore.
But the scallop dynamite, oh how grand,
The best in the Valley, fit for a king's land.
And the oranges, sweet and juicy too,
Gosh, how I missed them, my heart anew.
A three-year break, perhaps, did build my hopes high,
But alas, Sakana, still a place to try."

"Hark! 'Tis a place I oft visit, twixt home and river's flow, To grab a sub, and thus I shall bestow My favor upon this humble abode, For Subway and Blimpie's, I do not hold.

A market vast and full of wonders doth lie Within these walls, where olive oil doth flow free, And pasta, a whole aisle doth take its pride, And wooden tools for gnocchi, they doth provide.

The counter, long and full of treats doth run Along the back, where cheeses, meats, and sweets are shown, And sandwiches, ordered with great haste and speed, Doth please the palate, though the man doth seem to need A bit of cheer, for he doth wear a frown, And woos the customer with his gruff tone.

But fear not, for the lady at the till Doth make amends with her sweet, gentle will, And thus, I shall continue to support this place, Though sandwiches, just average, doth leave me in disgrace. But still, the products here, they doth excel, And thus, my rating, so-so, doth tell."

"Place is alright. Restaurant's got a nice setup, good service, and entertainment's decent. Food's good, but overpriced. Steaks are a bit too done for my liking, but the au gratin spuds are tasty. Wine list is solid, plenty of choices. Worth a shot if you're at GVR, but I prefer the Strip's steakhouses overall."

"OPI on the cheap, read Carina's review. Didn't wanna shell out eight fifty at Ulta. Geez, what a steal. Colors already separated, heat or age, who knows. Choose price over quality, that's my motto. Four bucks, I'm a cool cat. Same plaza as Lee Lee's, next to China Magic Noodle."

Hark! Went in for an early dinner, and thus did order
The Pot Roast Sandwich, with much anticipation.
The veggies came, and lo! They were not cooked,
Raw, they were, and I did eat the meat, with great relish.
I told the waitress, and she did say,
"Tis normal, indeed," and offered me another side dish.
I was glad, yet somewhat subdued,
For this, it seemed, was their usual way.
My husband, he did enjoy his chili burger much,
And our drinks, they were quite strong, with no small touch.
This place, it doth bustle with activity,
Yet, mayhap, we did choose the wrong victuality.

"Carne assada torta, not bad. Price, real good. But, jeez, comically unorganized. No process. Got my food, but should've been sooner. Grill, dirty. Meat, fatty, chewy. Dining area, not clean. Not a 3, not a 2. Gave 'em the benefit."

"Perched upon a stool, I sipped my brew,
Asked twice, and still no melody did break,
The silence, like a shroud, did cloak the room,
Until a distant beat, a reggae tune did creep,
Soft whispers, barely heard, did reach mine ear,
As bartender, with a smile, did turn it clear.
No victuals on the board, to claim my share,
But Cuba Libra's, three, my thirst did slake,
I savored each, and pondered on the fare,
If worth a visit, back again, I shall partake."

"Far from the French Quarter we dwell,
My stomach seldom urges me to tell
Of Cajun dishes, let's be frank,
Few choices here, a truth to rank.
This place becomes the go-to spot,
To satisfy the gumbo craving, no doubt.
Average fare, good service, prices high,
A bit steep, yet still worth a try."

"Went to this buffet, nice decor, couple weeks back. Good, not the best I've had. Agree with others, options were limited. Quality was good, portion control decent. Three-star place, tops. Didn't do the weekend buffet, $40 and up, most said. Went on a Monday, brunch time, $22 or so. Filled me up, but options got old quick, done in 45 minutes. Expected more from a joint that looks so sharp."

"Hark, what news is this? In Las Vegas, there be many lesbians, fair sir! They doth wear their hair in mullets, and their attire doth resemble jean vests with ripped sleeves. By my troth, 'tis a sight to behold! \n\nBut soft, what light through yonder window breaks? A sushi bar, perchance? Alas, the prices be too steep, good sir! For $15-17, a roll of fish doth seem a dear price to pay. Methinks 'tis wiser to journey to Oakland, where such delights may be had at a lower cost."

"Methought the burgers' pics didst look most wondrous and fair,
But lo, the portions, they were quite feasible, I swear.
Our group of five didst share these dishes, so bright:
Sashimi "won-tacos," triple T fries, the original burger in sight.
And bacon mac-n-cheese burger, a curious delight.
We might have had room for another dish, I do suppose,
But my favorites, the fries and burger, they didst please.
The fries, so crisp and full of truffle zest,
Aioi, a flavor most excellent, I must confess.
The burger, with flavors I do hold most dear,
Though bacon mac-n-cheese, a unique blend, I do hear.
But to me, the burgers, a bit above the rest,
Not a favorite, alas, that I wouldst request.
Bachi burger, or even Holsteins, my heart doth sway,
For tacos, a disappointment, a small portion, I say.
So, to this place, I wouldst return, for beer and fries alone,
For they didst please my taste buds, and made my day now gone."

"Desserts, good. Service, bad. Prices, steep. Staff, couldn't care less. We ordered the trio, asked for a replacement since the first was damaged. She told another worker instead of doing it herself. Didn't notice till we paid and sat down. Had to bring it back. Shouldn't have had to deal with that."

"I had to update y'all. So, I was at BuyBack$, near Galleria Mall, and we couldn't find what we needed. Called the Decatur location, and they had it on Blu-ray, of course. Asked them to hold it, and they said sure thing. Drove across town, and what do you know? They told us some other folks got there first, it was already spoken for. Told 'em we came from far away, they said management decides. Didn't get the movie, but I gave 'em a piece of my mind. Won't be going out of my way to come back, that's for sure. Lost a good customer, they did."

"Been here a few times. It's a chain, so I don't usually eat here. But my husband wanted to go, thought it was BJ's. He was disappointed, they only have lager. Last night was different. Server Paul was great, knew his beer, gave my kids extra fruit. Food was good, fish and chips were decent, garlic fries were better. Cheeseburger with blue cheese was nothing special. Had some bad experiences here before, but last night was a 5-star night. Hope it's a sign of things to come."

"Saturday night, warm and sunny. Envied those on the patio, twinkling lights above, as I sat in the dark interior. Salad, pear and arugula, good but not filling. Eight bucks. Others drank, maybe a better choice."

"Happy hour at its finest. Good drink specials, half-priced apps and rolls. Perfect for a quick bite and a cold beer with friends. Not the best choice for a romantic dinner, but great for a casual night out. A-OK from me."

"Prices here are decent, some cheaper than Safeway, others on par with Fry's. Depends what you're looking for. Personally, I prefer Fry's in my neighborhood since the Albertson's nearby always reeks of rotten fish, enough to make me vomit. This place is conveniently located near my friend's apartment, so we swing by when we need something. Quick in and out, good customer service."

"In fair Verona, where we didst dine,
A buffet, our first try, didst shine.
At forty pieces of silver, a fair price,
The victuals, though few, didst please our taste.
Na'an, oh Na'an, how sweet thy flavor doth lie,
I couldst have devoured thee till the morning sky.
Thy brisket, dear husband, didst thou enjoy with glee,
And all, though plain, was clean and bright to see.
But alas, the hall, a cafeteria doth bear,
So, methinks, 'tis not worth going out of our way there."

"Sunday lunch at this joint, busy spot. Food's alright, not amazing but decent. Service good, place clean. Plenty of options. Waited a while for grub. Prices ain't too steep. Might give 'em another shot for dinner."

"Waitin' at the drive-thru, ain't no picnic. Today, it was a real bust. Two cars ahead, and I'm sittin' there for damn near 15 minutes. Just for a sandwich and a smoothie, nothin' fancy. Service is gettin' slower each time I go. Makes me think twice 'bout comin' back."

"Methinks I was surprised at how much I didst enjoy Kahunaville, forsooth! The sandwiches, priced at a mere 11 crowns, were of generous proportion, indeed. The drinks, alack, were costly, as is the wont of Las Vegas, but the server, a friendly and courteous lass, didst pour them with a generous hand. I do recommend, with great enthusiasm, a yard of Bombay and tonic, 'twill quench thy thirst most thoroughly! Our server, despite one of our company's uncouth behavior, didst attend to us with diligence and grace, her station well-maintained."

"Panda Express with a twist - a drive-thru for convenience. Service is meh, but let's be real, it's not like we're there for the small talk. Food's solid, portions are decent, and it's close to some shopping spots. That's all that matters."

"Upon a night most fair, my date and I didst venture forth to The Lodge, a place of merriment and cheer.  With hearts full of hope and bellies empty, we didst seek to quench our thirst and satisfy our hunger.  And lo, the prices were most reasonable, a true delight!  The servers, too, were friendly and kind, their smiles as bright as the sun in high summer.  But alas, the bar stools, how uncomfortable they were!  A plague upon them, say I!  Yet, despite this minor woe, we didst enjoy the deep fried cheese curds, a culinary delight most rare.  (Forsooth, I hail from Wisconsin, land of the cheese curd!)  And thus, we didst decide to return, but next time, at a table, where we might sit in greater comfort.  Pray, good sir or madam, tell me, what dost thou think of this tale?  Doth it please thee, or doth it leave thee cold?  Prithee, let me know, that I might learn and grow."

"Hark! This West End eatery doth boast a claim most rare,
The oldest Chinese restaurant in all of Edinburgh fair!
'Tis over 50 years of age, a local treasure true,
That draws folk in with flavors, as if by magic sleight.

The name may raise an eyebrow, but fear not, dear guest,
For within these walls, the food doth truly pass the test.
Cantonese and Peking cuisine, a feast for the taste,
With choices galore, thy hunger to satiate.

Alas, the desserts, a humble offering, 'tis true,
Yet still, a sweet delight, with bananas, anew.
A constant, it seemeth, in each Chinese hall,
A treat, no doubt, for those who dare to try them all.

But mark this well, good sirs and madams, a sign most fair,
That Chinese folk themselves do frequent this lair.
A surety, indeed, that the fare doth meet their approval,
A testament to the skill of the chef's artful removal."

"Hotel wasn't our scene, but the crap game? Top-notch. Double payout on 12, 100X odds. Cheap thrill on the Strip. Place could use a spruce, low ceilings, smoke-filled air. Locals, friendly. Drinks, meh."

"With eager feet, I didst hasten to this place,
A little too much, perchance.
We shared some 'croquettes' of foie gras,
Truly nothing out of the ordinary, alack.
Then, I was tempted by the happy pig's rib,
Tender meat, well-cooked, but the sauce, not quite right,
My friend had the duck breast, clearly deceiving.
Excellent pecan tart, but come hither for what?
In sooth, I am content to have dined here,
But other restaurants of like price do make me merrier."

"These digs, like the Teepee, take us back to a time when our Mexican grub was straightforward, our expectations low. But hey, it's still good eats. This joint's got some stories to tell, just ask Marty Robbins."

"A penny saved is a penny earned, they say,
But here, thou dost not get what thou pay.
No fridge, no kettle, nor coffee maker,
Nor microwave, to warm thy meager supper.
The carpets, old and stinky, do offend,
And faucet, broken, did our patience end.
But silently, the night did pass,
And close to all, the inn did stand.
Methinks, another time, I shall explore,
Other options, before coming once more."
"Sushi joint's mediocre, at best. Rice overpowers the fish. Pay extra for more substance? Hell yeah. No seating? Lame. Go there for quick work lunches. On par with grocery store sushi."
"Place was decent, had some good deals on beer. But the grub? Meh. Overpriced and underwhelming. Had the oyster po boy, wasn't impressed. If you're lookin' for seafood, best to head west."

"Hark, fair readers, listen well, for I have tale to tell,
Of shopping woes, and retail hell,
At Fry's, a place of woe, where help doth dwindle,
I sought a Kindle, but alas, 'twas hard to find,
Their wares, displayed at front, did ease my plight,
But oh, the pain, my feet did ache with every step,
In heels, I suffered, yet still I did pursue,
A case, a cute blue one, my heart didst incline,
But pink, or Kitty, wouldst have been divine,
Yet, staff, so helpful, didst make my day,
Unlike Fry's, where answers didst fade away,
When payment due, the cashier didst ask,
If rewards card, we didst possess,
But alas, past troubles, didst make me wary,
Gift rewards, to strange address, didst carry,
Through call center, manager, didst we plead,
But still, the address, didst remain unseated,
Thus, three stars, my rating doth confer,
For trust, doth falter, at this store, forevermore."

"The club was nothing special, but the view from the 53rd floor was something else. The city stretched out below us, a sprawling mess of lights and noise. But the distance from the Strip was a bitch, and the weather had to be just right or else going outside was a nightmare. Otherwise, the club was decent, but not much to write home about. A solid effort, but nothing to get too excited about."
